Department Description:
Huntington Center
41 S. High Street
Columbus, OH 43215
Brief Description: The Non-traditional Credit Review Team Lead will manage a team of professionals that monitors non-traditional credit risk throughout the Corporation. This credit risk is principally located in the capital markets, asset advisory/management and treasury functions of the Bank and affiliates of the Holding Company.
Detailed Description:
• The Team Lead will develop and manage a credit review program which assesses the management framework in selecting, underwriting, and administering the direct and indirect credit risk inherent in products, services and trading related activities administered by business segments identified with non-traditional credit risk.
• The program will also assess adherence to policies and procedures and compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.
• This candidate will have a thorough understanding of the market risks measured through various analytics and valuation tools in order to assess the adequacy of the active management and administration of the ensuing counterparty credit risks.
• The Non-traditional Credit Review Team Lead will create a “value added” organization by providing feedback and recommendations to enhance risk management practices and to consult and follow-up on management’s action plans as required.
• This position requires strong leadership skills in the ability to create and manage a team, define objectives, develop both strategic and tactical non-traditional credit review plans and execute those plans in a timely and effective manner.
Job Requirements:
Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree
• 7-10 years experience and knowledgeable of the products, services and trading related activities offered in the capital markets, asset advisory/management and treasury functions.
Additional Details:
Grade 74
EOE M/F/D/V
Huntington does not accept solicitations from third party recruiters for any position.

Department Description:
IT-Enterprise Solutions Architecture
Easton Business Service Center
Columbus, OH 43219
Brief Description: Chief Architect for ITG (M-F, 40 Hrs) – Enterprise Solutions Architecture. Leads the program to develop, maintain and govern the enterprise architecture (EA) across the organization.
Detailed Description:
This individual is also responsible for defining the EA process and architecture review process, and for leading the integration of those processes with related business and IT processes.
Examples of functions this position would be responsible for include:
• Lead the creation or evolution of the enterprise architecture function/program.
• Understand, advocate and support the enterprise's IT strategies.
• Lead the identification and analysis of enterprise business drivers to derive useful business context.
• Lead analysis of the current IT environment to detect critical deficiencies and recommend solutions for improvement.
• Lead analysis of technology industry and market trends to determine their potential impact on the enterprise architecture.
• Promote the EA process, outcomes and results to the organization, including the enterprise's IT and business leaders.
• Lead and facilitate the creation of governing principles to guide EA decision making.
• Lead the development of an implementation plan for the enterprise architecture based on business requirements and IT strategies.
• Ensure that the optimal governance structure and compliance activities (such as handling waivers) are associated with EA compliance.
• Oversee EA implementation and ongoing refinement activities.
• Oversee the evaluation and selection of EA standards.
• Consult with project teams to fit projects to enterprise architecture, as well as to identify when it is necessary to modify the enterprise architecture to accommodate project needs.
• Consult with infrastructure development project teams to fit infrastructure to architecture, as well as to identify when it is necessary to modify the technical architecture to accommodate infrastructure needs.
• Identify organizational requirements for the resources, structures and cultural changes necessary to support the enterprise architecture.
• Oversee the documentation of all architecture design and analysis work.
• Lead the development and execution of a communication and education plan for the enterprise architecture.
• Assess and communicate the value of the enterprise architecture.
• Own and direct the product lab resources to provide proactive testing of emerging technologies.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, systems analysis or a related field of study, or equivalent experience.
• Seven to 10 years of experience in at least two IT disciplines (such as technical architecture, network management, application development, SOA/middleware, information analysis, database management or operations) in a multitier environment — or five years of experience in business analysis or business strategic planning.
Other Traits, Characteristics and Experience
• Familiarity with basic information management practices.
• Exposure to multiple, diverse technologies and processing environments.
• Exceptional interpersonal skills, including teamwork, facilitation and negotiation.
• Strong leadership skills.
• Excellent analytical and technical skills.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Excellent planning and organizational skills.
• Knowledge of all components of holistic enterprise architecture.
• Knowledge of business re-engineering principles and processes.
• Basic knowledge of financial models and budgeting.
• Familiarity with basic graphical modeling approaches, tools and model repositories.
• Understanding of the political climate of the enterprise and how to navigate the politics.
• Ability to balance the long-term ('big picture') and short-term implications of individual decisions.
• Ability to translate business needs into EA requirements.
• Ability to estimate the financial impact of EA alternatives
• Ability to apply multiple solutions to business problems.
• Ability to rapidly comprehend the functions and capabilities of new technologies.
• Respected as a leader.
• Influential in the organization and a team player.
• Highly supportive of the business and of its ideals and strategies.
• Neutral toward technology, vendor and product choices; more interested in results than in personal preferences.
• Unflappable in the face of opposition to architectural ideals.
• Effective at driving short-term actions that are consistent with long-term goals.
• Innovative, but practical.
Additional Details:
Grade 74
EOE M/F/D/V
Huntington does not accept solicitations from 3rd party recruiters for any position.
No relocation is available for this position.

Organization Name: Specialty Banking Administration – Not For Profit Team
Department Description:
Specialty Banking Administration – Not For Profit (NFP) Team
Cleveland, OH
Brief Description: Leads and directs the corporate relationship activity for targeted NFP organizations, including all Colleges, Universities and large Associations within a defined Huntington region(s). Responsibilities include providing strategic direction and guidance for regional teams and supporting the implementation of NFP programming in the regional market; working in conjunction with the Regional NFP Leader(s) to orchestrate regional NFP sales teams and sales activities; providing industry knowledge and guidance to Regional NFP Leaders and NFP sales teams; making sales calls with commercial bankers and partners with total accountability for the sales process; providing innovative solutions and orchestration of internal and external partners; motivating and monitoring team performance by region and reporting results back to the regional team(s), senior and executive management.
Detailed Description:
· Develops and executes a regional NFP marketing strategy, including attracting, retaining and growing high-quality NFP relationships consistent with Huntington’s corporate NFP strategy
· Assists with setting and monitoring regional sales goals
· Manages the NFP sales process, including regional sales meetings, account planning, pipeline and appointment tracking
· Develops and maintains a current list of all NFP existing and prospective relationships by region; ensures team members are assigned on each relationship
· Actively makes sales calls with bankers and partners with total accountability for the sales process, including referrals to partners
· Supervises, motivates and monitors team performance by region as it relates to NFP sales – reports back to team(s) and senior and executive management
· Maintains detailed product knowledge of Huntington’s products and services
· Understands regional competition and gaps to best position Huntington against them
· Works in conjunction with the NFP Segment Leader and other business segment leaders throughout Huntington to ensure proper product set and developing comprehensive segment sales and proposal tools that support Huntington’s strategy
· Represents and actively participates in regional and national industry conferences and events
· Follows a disciplined and specialized practice around NFP credit activities that generates revenue, deepens and strengthens relationships, and mitigates risk for Huntington
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
· Bachelor’s Degree
· 7-10 years of experience with middle market commercial banking sales or related business environment
· Not-For-Profit industry expertise
· Advanced presentation, negotiation, and communications skills
· Strong team leadership skills
Additional Details:
Grade 73
EOE M/V/D/F
Huntington does not accept solicitations from 3rd Party Recruiters for any position

Department Description:
IT-Information Security
Easton Business Service Center
Columbus, OH 43219
Brief Description: IT Security Analyst - Full-time/flexible hours including hours beyond the normal schedule when necessary. Assist in assessing the level of security risk for the bank by evaluating data received about security threats.
Detailed Description:
Information Security is working to develop new procedures to improve our abilities to identify and mitigate security risks within the Huntington environment. This position will be responsible for monitoring security controls to detect and respond to threats present in the Huntington environment and for reviewing new technology projects for security risks and helping to mitigate those risks prior to production. The person will also be responsible for establishing a governance and controls process to define and monitor key controls across the enterprise and drive automation into these processes.
The successful candidate will collaborate with the different IT and non-IT business areas, keep current with regulatory frameworks, internal policy, as well as provide guidance, training, and support in order to effectively manage compliance at Huntington.
The successful candidate, in addition to his/her primary responsibilities, will support the initiatives of the team. These additional assignments are in the areas of Threat and Vulnerability Management, Event Management, Platform Security, Data Loss Protection and Project Management. These activities also include acting as a subject matter expert in a core area of technology, to ensure proper communication, coordination, and remediation follow up. This is accomplished with effective detailed communication, understanding of technology issues and problems, and collaboration on these to find workable solutions for the business, technologies, and security that appropriately manage risk.
Primary roles and responsibilities include:
· Assist in assessing the level of security risk for the bank by evaluating data received about security threats, assigning priority ratings for remediation, and communicating the risks to the proper teams and leaders for mitigation.
· Retrieve, analyze, or provide reports that determine the security state of the corporation’s environment, coordinate the response to the Threat and Vulnerability Management Team, and assign responsibility for remediation to the appropriate organization and/or individual.
· Assist in the evaluation of Security solutions and determine their functionality, effectiveness and efficiency presenting findings and recommendations to management.
· Monitor security tools for unauthorized activity and follow up as needed on suspicious activity noted. Represent information security as part of an on-going on-call rotation for outages.
· Review technical and procedural documentation for systems and solutions to ensure completeness and accuracy.
· Provides clear and concise recommendations and guidance in written and verbal form to both business and technology personnel.
· Contributes to the technical understanding and promotion of new and existing information security standards, solutions and tools.
· Identifies, reviews and recommends new security and risk technology that can be used to address business issues and reduce/mitigate risk.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
• CISSP Certified (or equivalent GIAC, ISACA, education equivalent required)
• Bachelors Degree in Technology related field of study
• 3 years of progressively responsible experience in Information Technology (including application, server, and or database experience).
• 1-3 years of recent hands on experience in either Unix, Database, and/or Web middleware technologies with full understanding of managing security issues on these platforms.
• 2-3 years experience in information security or related training in information security disciplines
Other Traits, Characteristics, and Experience
• Demonstrated experience in identifying and coordinating secure configurations on Unix, Network and or Database platforms, planning Access Controls (including roles based controls) and Privileged User Monitoring, identifying appropriate patch management policies and ITIL process leadership. This includes ensuring applications developed comply to these configurations
• Demonstrated experience influencing system administrators and business leaders to enhance security process and enable the business through security.
• Strong understanding of risk management and measuring techniques
• Knowledge of with current IT Security technologies (WSS, PKI, ISO27001/2, FISAP, NIST 800-53, CoBit, SCAP)
• Knowledge of eDirectory/Active Directory preferred
• Knowledge of Novell products a plus
• Must be able to work well under time constraints
• Must be able to maintain confidentiality
Additional Details:
Grade 71
EOE M/F/D/V
Huntington does not accept solicitations from 3rd party recruiters for any position.
No relocation is available for this position.
Based on experience this position may be filled at a senior level.
How To Apply: Click on the Apply Now button

Department Description:
Commercial Banking
Cleveland, OH
Brief Description: Account Relationship Associate Sr., Full-time. Provides administrative support for the Commercial Banking Team. Responsible for assisting with Business Development and Sales, On-boarding, and Service.
Detailed Description:
This Account Relationship Associate position provides 'Simply the Best' customer service at all times.
Primary Functions:
· Answers incoming phone lines and provides solutions for customer inquiries, handles the situation, performs all draws, payments and account transfers as requested by the Customer and Commercial Team.
· Inputs referrals into MAX on the banker’s behalf as requested or needed.
· May be introduced to the customer in person at the point of sale to become the main point of contact.
· Must be committed to providing extraordinary customer service at all times.
· Works directly with the Loan Closing Specialists to on-board loan customers.
· Provides pre-call planning and profiling tools to the Relationship Managers and other Commercial Banking Colleagues.
· Provides consistent Product Data sheets and other collateral marketing materials to the bankers, prospects, and clients.
· Owns, manages, and pulls reports from industry tools such as LexisNexis, First Research, D & B, etc.
· Has familiarity with customer complimentary Bank products.
· Performs basic clerical assignments.
· Assists in special projects as requested.
· Prepares various internal reports, memos and correspondence.
Quality Assurance: Adheres to bank policies and procedures and complies with legal and regulatory requirements. Follows effective controls and processes to ensure risks are measured, monitored and controlled and compliance requirements are adhered to on an on-going basis. Keeps abreast of risk related changes that may impact assigned work functions and processes.
Product Knowledge: Have enough knowledge to be conversant about some of the Commercial products, ask basic questions, take initiative to learn, and pull in the proper resources when needed.
Technology: Effective utilization of AFS and other loan systems, iNet, Sant, TREMOLO, ESS, MAX, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint Applications. Intro to intermediate knowledge of bank products. Good oral and written communication skills required.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
· 1-3 years of Banking sales and/or client support experience required. This includes Commercial, Commercial Real Estate, Business, and/or Retail Banking. If coming from a Branch, experience as Personal Banker is required
· Bachelor’s degree required
Other Traits, Characteristics and Experience
· Excellent customer service, highly motivated, focused, and goal oriented
· Must have excellent written and verbal (face-to-face and phone) communication skills including professional grammar and demeanor
· Strong organizational skills with attention to detail, planning and follow-up
· Demonstrated ability to proactively cross-sell products and services.
· Experience/knowledge of Commercial Banking products.
· Ability to handle multiple priorities and independently problem solve.
· PC proficiency, including Excel, Word, and PowerPoint required. Experience with AFS and other loan systems (iNet, Sant, TREMOLO, ESS, MAX) preferred.

Department Description:
Treasury Management
The Huntington National Bank917 Euclid AvenueCleveland, OH 44115
Brief Description: Treasury Management Sales Advisor. Fulltime. Responsible for identifying Treasury Management opportunities with prospects and clients.
Detailed Description: Huntington’s team manages financial relationships with companies maintaining revenues in Commerical Middle Market for companies with revenues between $15M-$500MM, including many large national retailers, insurance agencies and manufacturing companies. The ideal candidate will possess detailed knowledge with retail payment strategies and products. Through consultative, needs-based selling, the Commercial Middle Market Treasury Management Sales Advisor is responsible for identifying Treasury Management sales opportunities with both prospects and clients. Position duties include independent Treasury Management sales prospecting, cross-selling to existing clients, product pricing and account structuring, proposal creation and presentation, and performing client reviews. Through a strong partnership with Relationship Bankers, the Sales Advisor carries out market, portfolio, and deposit strategies while identifying cross-sell opportunities for other lines of business. The Sales Advisor must stay current on competitor offerings, and provide market and competitor feedback to ensure competitiveness. Cross sells other bank products, and stays current on competitor offerings to suggest product improvements.
Job Requirements:
A minimum of 5 years in Treasury Management Sales or Commercial Lending, with a specialization in managing large national retailers, is required. 
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent (7 years of Treasury Management sales experience) is required.

Department Description:
Huntington National Bank
917 Euclid Ave
Cleveland, OH 44115
Brief Description: Management responsibility for team of portfolio managers and analysts who work with clients on a daily basis. Responsible for the development and implementation of a team strategy to meet assigned goals, mitigate risk and underwrite transactions that are originated by the corporate banking team. Ensures that overall portfolio of relationships and transactions are in alignment with the risk profile of the bank. Responsible for maintaining acceptable levels of credit quality, consistent with the bank’s credit policies, procedures, and guidelines including regular monthly, quarterly and annual portfolio tracking/reporting within established tolerances. Maintains a highly credible relationship between portfolio management and HNB’s credit approval authorities. Develops robust portfolio analysis processes and data capture processes that manage risk and that generate valuable market insights to management and clients that help the bank and clients win. Accountable for identifying client needs within the portfolio and referring to corporate banking team for urgent execution to drive revenue growth and market share growth.
Detailed Description:
Leadership: Coaches; counsels; creates and maintains culture based on teamwork, transparency, innovation and desire to win. Creates a positive and productive partnership with the corporate banking team. Mentors new employees and fosters career paths as portfolio management serves as an important entry point for the organization. Actively participates in design and implementation of regional banking strategy with fellow management team members.
Quality Assurance:
Adheres to bank policies and procedures and complies with legal and regulatory requirements. Accountable for risk management, compliance and audit performance for area(s) of responsibility. Establishes or works with management to develop effective controls and processes to ensure risks are measured, monitored and controlled and compliance requirements are adhered to on an on-going basis. If applicable, ensures staff is properly trained, provided with appropriate resources and motivated to adhere to risk management principles. Maintains current knowledge of risk-related changes that may impact assigned area(s) of responsibility.
Administrative: develops work schedules; responsible for hiring, terminations, salary adjustments and/or disciplinary actions; conducts regular performance reviews and actively implements “pay for performance” culture. Establishes/communicates portfolio management strategy.
Reporting: SVP level position reporting directly to Regional President.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
- Minimum of 7 years of underwriting and documentation of Middle Market loans.
- Must have previous formalized credit training.
- Bachelors degree is required.
Other Traits & Characteristics:
- Previous management experience is strongly preferred.
- Proven consistent and effective negotiation skills
- Proficiency in written and verbal communication is required.
- Working knowledge of Microsoft Office software programs required.
- Demonstrated success structuring complex credits: researching, judging and presenting information verbally and in writing, and creating documentation to support the credit and minimize risk.
- Demonstrated leadership experience by having provided coaching, skill development, and feedback to team members.
- High level of professionalism.

• An Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V
• Huntington does not accept solicitations from Third Party Recruiters for any positions.

Department Description:
Pittsburgh Commercial Banking
The TimesBuilding
336 Fourth Ave, Suite 2
Pittsburgh, PA15222
Brief Description: Create and execute effective marketing strategies leading to the acquisition and retention of targeted Huntington commercial banking prospects and clients within defined market territories. Develop and maintain profitable client relationships working with Portfolio Managers, Treasury Management Specialists, and various other Product Partners.
Detailed Description:
Business Development & Sales: With highest priority given to clients and prospects, relationship managers will proactively identify problems/solutions and deliver Simply the Best Service through disciplined strategies and processes.
¨ Establish and maintain prospect list for assigned territories. Creation and execution of weekly marketing letter campaign with goal of issuing and following up on 10-15 letters per week.
¨ Be capable of flexing to audience and clearly articulate HNB value proposition.
¨ Produce Weekly Goals for discussion and execution with Sales Team Leader. Submit results on Friday.
¨ Form and execute practical client entertainment strategies ensuring tangible return is generated from investment of time. Assist in the development and retention of existing clients through effective client relationship development plans.
¨ Coordinate and implement on boarding process with each new IHC.
¨ Obtain at least 2 referrals (with goal of 3) from existing clients during the year.
¨ Lead / prepare proposals, term sheets, and preview memos. Lead the presentation of all preview and approval meetings.
¨ Transfer call information and review CRISP Pipeline information to assure accuracy to/with Sales Associate on Weekly basis.
¨ Attend, be engaged, and execute action steps coming from Weekly Sales Meetings.
Product Knowledge: Have enough knowledge to be conversant about all the commercial products, ask basic questions, take initiative to learn, and pull in the proper resources when needed.
¨ Understands features and benefits of core commercial products
¨ Ability to convert benefits into solutions for the customer
¨ Understanding of essential partner product set
¨ Understands pricing, including cost/benefit analysis
¨ Ability to differentiate HNB’s products from competitors
Leadership and Partner Integration: Leadership is a skill that facilitates proactive decision making such that the account executive is motivated and disciplined to set challenging goals, while eager to improve those around them.
¨ Established personal goals to purposely stretch skills and abilities
¨ Ability to motivate and empower relationship team members
¨ Coach/Mentor other CBD members within and across teams to help them develop
¨ Ability to make timely decisions
¨ Delegates tasks to the appropriate team members
¨ Involvement with professional network to be visible to subordinates and management
¨ Active participation in HNB sponsored events
¨ Participation in community events, serving on local boards, demonstrating Huntington support for the local community.
Technology: Integration of current technologies is essential for relationship managers to readily track portfolios and deliver prompt responses to both customers and Essential Partners.
¨ Effective utilization of CRISP
¨ Effective utilization of Lotus Notes
¨ Effective utilization of Excel and Word applications
¨ Effective utilization of online industry tools
Living the Huntington Values: Represent, communicate, endorse, and behave according to Huntington’s Vision and Values in your daily activity. These include the following:
¨ Teamwork
¨ Communication
¨ Accountability
¨ Passion
¨ Diversity
¨ Service
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
· 3-5 years experience as a Commercial Relationship Manager or Sales Executive with proven sales experience in a calling environment
· Bachelor’s degree is required 
· Demonstrated consistent and effective negotiation skills
· Sound judgment in handling all aspects of customer relationships
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills, along with a high level of professionalism
· Demonstrated knowledge of credit structure, along with thorough understanding of current banking and capital markets
Additional Criteria:
· MBA is preferred
· Formal credit training is desirable
· Ability and desire to cross-sell other bank products

Department Description:
Huntington Center
41 S. High Street
Columbus, OH 43287
Brief Description: Economic Capital Risk Analyst will contribute to the implementation and ongoing development of an Economic Capital (EC) framework under the Basel Internal Capital Adequacy Assessment Process (ICAAP). This position will provide an exciting opportunity for anyone interesting in a new, challenging field.
Detailed Description:
· Execute quantitative risk management methodologies to estimate monthly economic capital requirements for consumer (and other asset class) loan products and accounts using vendor’s model
· Test and confirm model results; evaluate data integrity
· Analyze quarterly product EC requirements to assess capital usage and movement in risk profiles over time.
· Prepare ad-hoc analysis and reporting as requested
· Perform ongoing model testing and monitoring of credit EC results
· Establish and maintain operational modeling procedures; document key EC model methods and assumptions.
· Support the ICAAP project, especially related to consumer credit risk and scenario analysis.
Job Requirements:
· Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, Math or Engineering. MS a plus
· 2 to 7 years experience in consumer credit risk analysis
· Exposure to risk modeling techniques a plus
· Team player and having ability to meet deadlines and demonstrate ability and willingness to take ownership

Department Description:
Huntington Center
41 S. High Street
Columbus, OH 43287
Brief Description: The candidate will evaluate and monitor the bank’s interest rate risk and liquidity risk positions, providing independent analyses on current and future trends against key risk indicators.
Detailed Description:
· Conduct independent evaluation and assessment of the bank’s Interest Rate and Liquidity/Funding Risk positions. The risk assessments will review key risk indicators, trends, emerging issues, risk management actions, risk limit exceptions and external economic and/or regulatory issues and impact over a variety of stressed conditions.
· Provide feedback and analysis regarding best practices and peer comparisons.
• Review and assess current policies and processes specific to liquidity and interest rate risk as well as adherence to regulatory requirements and/or policies.
• Understand the impact of interest rate fluctuations on the bank’s interest rate and liquidity positions and be familiar with interest rate terminology and concepts. Follow market movements and emerging domestic and global issues.
• Have a good understanding of interest rate and liquidity management tools and models, how they are used to measure, monitor and manage liquidity and interest rate risk in order to form an independent opinion on the effectiveness of the controls and processes.
• Familiar with bank and bank holding company balance sheets, income statements and regulatory reporting.
• Provide constructive feedback to senior managers and risk committee members regarding risk management enhancements and as a follow up to specific risk management action plans.
· Attend and participate in liquidity and interest rate risk committee meetings.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
• Master’s degree in finance or quantitative sciences/math desired
• 3-7 years experience with Bank Asset Liability and Liquidity management or interest rate risk modeling
• Excellent oral and written communication skills; experience in presenting to senior and/or executive management
• Self starter, highly motivated and comfortable working in a fast paced environment
• Proficient in data base and Excel software

Department Description:
Huntington National Bank
17 S. High Street
Columbus, OH 43215
Brief Description: The Compliance Section Manager (CSM) oversees all ongoing activities related to the development, implementation, review, maintenance of, and adherence to, the compliance policies and procedures of Huntington Bancshares Incorporated and its subsidiaries (HBI). The CSM is responsible for identifying, advising and monitoring for compliance issues, concerns, and deficiencies for HBI.
Detailed Description:
- Ensures the on-going development and maintenance of the Home Lending regulatory compliance programs. The regulatory compliance programs include regulatory requirements related to any of the following laws or issues: Bank Secrecy Act (BSA); Community Reinvestment Act (CRA); Electronic Fund Transfers Act (EFTA); Equal Credit Opportunity Act (ECOA); Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA); Fair Housing Act (FHA); Flood Disaster Protection Act (FDPA); Home Mortgage Disclosure Act (HMDA); Home Owners Equity Protection Act (HOEPA); Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC Regulations); Privacy of Consumer Financial Information; Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act (RESPA); Right to Financial Privacy Act (RFPA); Truth-in-Lending Act (TILA); Unfair or Deceptive Acts or Practices (UDAP); USA PATRIOT Act; Secure and Fair Enforcement for Mortgage Licensing Act (SAFE Act); and applicable regulatory guidances, state and local regulations.
- Mitigates regulatory risk by communicating regularly with Home Lending management through either formal activities such as committee participation, or by quickly intervening through less formal communications, or by proactively identifying opportunities for enhancements to existing policies and procedures. Provides guidance and feedback to Home Lending personnel on all regulatory policy, procedure and process development activities.
- Identifies and monitors regulatory risk by providing on-going oversight, analysis and research assistance to the Home Lending group. Such activities relate to development of the following: loan products and services; quality control review processes; post closing review processes; computer systems/websites, and employee training.
- Periodically monitors regulatory compliance on high-risk matters. Also periodically tests or supervises tests of systems, or other processes deemed likely to have regulatory impacts. Monitors compliance with internal policies and escalates exceptions to senior management.
- Measures regulatory and compliance risk by periodically performing/managing ad hoc targeted reviews, and by involvement in appropriate Home Lending processes as described above.
- Works with Home Lending to identify and implement compliance control testing and related action plans.
- Completes quarterly risk assessments for Home Lending to assess risk associated with activities or events and documents plans to mitigate or eliminate risk. Provides risk assessment to Compliance and applicable business segment management.
- Participates in new product development and oversees the development of new documents, procedures, reports or systems programming deemed necessary to reasonably ensure compliance. Provides compliance support of various marketing projects and requests.
- Duties for this position include completing and distributing periodic risk assessments, monitoring, development of testing, serving as a liaison to external and internal auditors, and communicating the following to business segments and senior and executive management: regulatory issuances, changes and guidance, policy exceptions, and compliance issues.
-This position supports the Mortgage and Consumer Lending (collectively, Home Lending) business segments. Additionally, this CSM will be responsible for identifying interrelated lending risks within Home Lending and for supervising the CSMs currently providing support.
- This position may also provide additional support to other consumer lending business segments on an as needed basis.
Job Requirements:
Qualifications:
• Bachelors Degree
• Minimum of 5 years bank compliance responsibility or experience, including working knowledge of applicable rules and regulations (including those identified above).
• Mortgage lending and investor (Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac, private, etc.) compliance experience preferred.
Other Requirements:
• At least 5 years of experience demonstrating independent analysis, assessment and resolution of moderately complex to complex issues.
• Demonstrate excellent analytical skills, strong attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, and ability to make independent decisions.
• Must possess strong working knowledge of applications within Microsoft Office Suite.
• Must be able to work independently, as part of a group, or group leader to resolve issues and meet deadlines. 
• Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Additional Details:
Grade 73
EOE/M/F/D/V
Huntington does not accept solicitation from any 3rd Party Recruiter for any position

The Times Building
336 Fourth Ave, Suite 2
Pittsburgh, PA 15222
Brief Description: Maintain, deepen, and retain assigned profitable client relationships by proactively evaluating and mitigating associated business risks and opportunities. Primarily responsible for; underwriting quality, portfolio administration, and credit quality of assigned portfolio working directly with the Division Manager, Regional Credit Officer, and Team Leader. Work directly with Sales Executives or Account Executives (as assigned), Treasury Management Specialists and various Product Partners to effectively present practical HNB financial solutions to clients as appropriate.
Detailed Description:
Business Development and Portfolio Management: Lead the underwriting and assist in the structuring of new IHC opportunities within established turnaround times by the client and Sales Executive or Account Executive.
• Transfer call information and review CRISP Pipeline information to assure accuracy to/with Sales Associate on Weekly basis.
• Attend, be engaged, and execute action steps coming from Weekly Sales Meetings.
• Assist when appropriate with the creation of; proposals, term sheets, and preview memos.
• Create Weekly Goals for discussion and execution with Portfolio Management Team Leader. Submit results on Friday.
• May meet with a minimum of 3 existing clients per week for proactive solution presentation. May have a goal to cross sale 2 new solutions to each client per year.
• Assist in market coverage by attending client entertainment events and attending at least 2 networking events per month.
• Direct management and communication of portfolio status with internal and external examiners.

• Ability to evaluate and understand macro risks
• Clear understanding of primary and secondary sources of repayment
• Appropriately ties structure and covenants to identify and mitigate risks

• Maintenance of 30+ day delinquencies and collateral exceptions below bank performance guidelines.

Product Knowledge: Have enough knowledge to be conversant about all the commercial lending products, ask basic questions, take initiative to learn, and pull in the proper resources when needed.
• Understands features and benefits of commercial lending products
• Ability to convert benefits into solutions for the customer
• Understanding of essential partner product set
• Understands pricing, including cost/benefit analysis
Leadership and Partner Integration: Leadership is a skill that facilitates proactive decision making such that the Portfolio Manager is motivated and disciplined to set challenging goals, while eager to improve those around them.
• Established personal goals to purposely stretch skills and abilities
• Ability to motivate and empower relationship team members
• Coach/Mentor other members within and across teams to help them develop
• Ability to make timely decisions
• Delegates tasks to the appropriate team members
• Involvement with professional network to be visible to subordinates and management
• Active participation in HNB sponsored events
• Participation in community events, serving on local boards, demonstrating Huntington support for the local community.
Technology: Integration of current technologies is essential to readily track portfolios and deliver prompt responses to both customers and Essential Partners.
• Effective utilization of Lotus Notes
• Effective utilization of CLOS/Velocity
• Effective utilization of Excel and Word applications
Job Requirements:

• MBA is preferred
• Formal credit training is desirable
• Ability and desire to cross-sell other bank products
• Demonstrated success structuring complex credits: researching, judging and presenting information verbally and in writing, and creating documentation to support the credit and minimize risk.

Department Description:
Commercial R/E Technical Services
Huntington Center
Columbus, OH 43287
Brief Description: Director, Residential Valuation - Reporting to the Chief Retail Credit Officer, the position ensures the efficient and effective utilization of appropriate residential valuation products in the lending process, with a focus on integrating property valuation into the overall origination process.
Detailed Description:
The position is responsible for assessing the current external environment regarding valuation methodologies, ensuring that Huntington is compliant with all regulations and highly competitive in the marketplace.
Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job:
1. Subject Matter Expertise – Serve as a key internal resource on the residential appraisal process, external factors impacting residential valuation, developing technology and tools, the regulatory environment, legislative actions, and market dynamics.
2. Policy Development – Provide consultation and advice to key business partners. Consider credit risk practices and techniques utilized by other Bank lending groups, the GSE’s, industry and vendor best practices, etc.
3. Process Development and Monitoring – Develop and implement an acceptable valuation review program consistent with regulatory expectations. Results of the review program should be directly integrated into the process and communicated with the affected business units.
4. Loss Mitigation/Foreclosure Process – Be an active participant in process and policy review related to key loss mitigation activities across the owned and serviced portfolios.
5. Ensure that the Huntington valuation process is part of a sound and efficient risk management culture, and that appropriate valuation methodologies are implemented and maintained.
6. Provide analytical and intuitive feedback as to product guidelines and parameters based on performance study, industry data, etc.
Job Requirements:
Required Skills and Competencies:
1. Bachelor's degree in business related field or equivalent education and related training
2. Knowledge of appraisal compliance/regulatory issues
3. Significant experience in residential origination and underwriting
4. Strong process improvement experience
5. Significant experience in due diligence of mortgage loan portfolios.
6. Strong leadership and management skills
7. Strong verbal and written communication skills
Desired Skills:
• Master of Business Administration (MBA) or graduate degree in business related field
• Experience in technology based, multi project work environment
• Experience and training in public speaking and group facilitation
Additional Details:
Grade 74
EOE M/F/D/V

Brief Description: Segment Risk Specialist will assist in the administration, development, implementation & maintenance of the risk management discipline partnering with the Treasury Management line of business.
Detailed Description:
• Work with the Treasury Management group to identify key risks and controls, and develop effective internal control processes and conduct testing of those controls.
• Create Process maps of areas to identify risks and controls within the line of business.
• Aid in the administration and governance of the enterprise fraud program; including identification and management of risks and coordination of action plans and enhancements.
• Perform the risk and control assessments. Identifies control deficiencies and escalate issues to Segment Risk Officer. Coordinate the Quarterly Risk Assessments for Treasury Management.
• Provide regulatory and operational expertise and help devise solutions to issues.
• Identify, assess, communicate and implement regulatory issuances.
• Ensure the timely completion of all testing and reporting requirements are within established guidelines. Testing to include SOX, Compliance, Internal Controls, Policy adherence and others as required.
• Ensure Audit recommendations are closed in a timely manner and tracked.
• Assist the line in the timely remediation of issues.
• Perform trend and data analysis of test results for Senior Management.
• Develops and maintains strong working relationships with the line management through continuous and proactive communications.
• Deliver timely and pertinent analysis to Senior Risk Officer on testing results, highlighting areas requiring attention and activities, which are inconsistent with Treasury Management policies and procedures
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
• 5 to 7 years experience in Treasury Management, International, Audit or Risk related area.
Other Traits, Characteristics, and Experience
• Problem Solving and Critical thinking
• Strong Written and Verbal Communication skills
• Ability to Identify root cause and proper solution
• Strong research and analytical skills
• Ability to multi-task and work in a fast pace environment
• Proficient in MS Office skills
Additional Details:
Grade 71 - - Position may be filled as a Senior level, Grade 72, based on experience.
EOE M/F/D/V
Huntington does not accept solicitations from 3rd party recruiters for any position.
No relocation is available for this position.
How To Apply: Click on the Apply Now button

Department Description: Easton facility, 7 Easton Oval, Columbus, OH 43219
Brief Description: Assists senior product managers in the design, development, and ongoing planning of products. May have direct product management responsibility for a specific function or segment within the general product management responsibility. Analyzes and reviews products for profitability and recommends changes to maximize profitability. Provides bank personnel with information and training necessary to successfully promote the product. · Ongoing product management
· Manage multiple responsibilities and tasks with the ability to properly prioritize for business needs
· Effectively communicate with all levels within an organization concerning product results
Ensure product is at all times compliant with relevant regulations by working with Legal & Compliance

· 5-7 years marketing experience 
· SEO and SEM expertise
· Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite.

Brief Description: Compliance Section Manager--FT/exempt--This position is responsible for monitoring and improving the performance of the company’s CRA initiative and the Community Commitment Program.
Detailed Description:
Responsibilities include:
• Partnering with respective Senior Management, this incumbent will communicate the company’s CRA goals and objectives
• Providing performance related analytics, identifying weaknesses, trends and opportunities, to Senior Management and line managers, as well as in response to complaints, protests and data requests
• Partnering with Senior Management and line managers, helping to develop and oversee implementation of performance plans focused on reducing deficiencies and ensuring CRA objectives are attained
• Actively participating in the development and implementation of the CRA Management Group’s strategic direction
• Assisting in the coordination of materials and preparation for CRA examinations
• Leading, or as part of a team, managing merger related due diligence and conversion activities
• Developing CRA training materials, conducting training and/or trains trainers
• Pursuing opportunities for process improvement, cost savings and mutual charter agreements

• 7 or more years of experience in a community development role
• 10 or more years of business development experience in a bank
• Bachelor’s Degree required
Other Traits and Characteristics:
• Expert level experience in Community Reinvestment Act compliance
• PC and Internet proficiency

• Excellent interpersonal, organizational, written and verbal communication skills

Department Description:
The Huntington National Bank
41 S. High Street
Columbus, OH 43287
Brief Description: Directs all aspects of the company’s Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) Program to ensure that adequate and effective internal controls over financial reporting are in place and operating effectively.
Detailed Description:
Responsibilities
· Development of key strategies and program initiatives designed to ensure compliance with SOX 404 and FDIC Improvement Act (FDICIA) requirements.
· Creation of all the necessary standards and guidance for the efficient and effective communication, implementation, execution, monitoring, and reporting of the SOX 404/FDICIA Program, throughout Huntington.
· Performance of the SOX 404/FDICIA financial statement scoping exercise for Huntington and present conclusions and recommendations for coverage to the SOX Executive Steering Committee (ESC).
· Oversight of the company’s SOX documentation and testing processes to ensure that documentation is complete and accurate and that testing is being performed in accordance with standard.
· Analysis of testing deficiencies, actual and potential loss events, internal and external audit findings, and corporate issues in order to determine SOX 404/FDICIA relevance and recommended impact classification.
· Communication of SOX and FDICIA status updates to executive management and governance committees, including the SOX ESC.
Job Requirements:
· Bachelor’s Degree.
· 8 to 10 years of risk management, audit, and/or SOX experience.
· Certification (e.g., CPA, CIA, etc.) preferred.
· Demonstrated leadership ability managing a finance and/or risk team/function.
· Extensive knowledge of SOX 404 and FDICIA requirements and best practices.
· In depth knowledge of risk management procedures/principles including risk and control identification, control testing, and issue analysis/resolution.
Other Traits:
· Excellent influencing, consulting and communication skills.
· Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
· Ability to multi-task and work in a fast paced environment.
· Team player.
Additional Details:
Grade 75
EOE/M/F/D/V

Department Description: Business Banking - Akron/Kent/Summit County Market - Home base is flexible
Brief Description: Business Banker, Full time. Responsibilities include developing and maintaining profitable Business Banking relationships. Based on experience, this position may be filled at a senior level.
Detailed Description:
Our Business Bankers provide “Simply the Best” customer service at all times.
In this position, you will be responsible for:
• Developing and maintaining profitable business banking relationships.
• Portfolio sizes that may vary in terms of complexity of credits and number of accounts.
• Analyzing composition of portfolios to determine if retention and expansion of existing client relationships is the primary focus versus acquisition of new business.
• Identifying needs, recommending products (including cross sales) and negotiating loan terms.
• Coordinating approval of loans through the Business Loan Center.
• Partnering with banking office staff and Business Development Leader to promote business banking sales.
• Monitoring maturing loans and upcoming renewals. 
• Adhering to pricing discipline and credit quality standards.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
• Minimum of 3-5 years experience selling products to small business clients required
• Bachelor's degree or an additional 2 years small business sales experience
• Commercial credit training or experience and prior lending experience required
• Previous business loan portfolio management experience required
Other Traits, Characteristics and Experience
• Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills required
• Must have excellent written and verbal (face-to-face and phone) communication skills including professional grammar and demeanor
• General knowledge of business deposit products preferred
• Direct outside financial sales experience preferred
• Strong organizational skills with attention to detail
• Ability to multi-task
• PC and internet proficiency

Department Description: Huntington Wealth Advisors
Brief Description: Wealth Management Investment Advisor – Fulltime -- Responsibilities include transitioning current client base to Huntington Wealth Advisors, as well as clients profiling and planning.
Detailed Description:
The individual in this position is responsible for transitioning current client base to Huntington Wealth Advisors, client profiling and planning, attaining revenue growth in the market and building brand awareness in the market.
The primary role of this position is to significantly strengthen relationships with all existing customers by offering investment solutions. You will be viewed as a key partner in contributing to the future growth of Huntington Wealth Advisors by referring financial advisors from other firms to consider the Huntington Wealth Advisor platform.
Huntington values your ability to develop new relationships with prospective customers by providing sound financial information and solutions. You will gain tremendous satisfaction knowing that you, along with your business partners, were critical in helping your customers achieve their long term goals.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
· Bachelor's Degree
· Three or more years of brokerage/securities sales experience
· Series 7 license
· Series 63 and 65 or Series 66 within 90 days of employment

Department Description:
Holland Call Center
This high volume sales and service position will allow you to engage your customer service skills by delivering prompt and accurate answers to telephone banking customers while identifying new opportunities and solutions. 
**Candidates must be available to work 11AM-8PM, 12PM-9PM, 1PM-10PM or 3PM-Midnight during the week. Weekend and holidays required**
Brief Description:
Customer Service Associate, FT. Works individually and as a team to meet and exceed established sales and service goals. Provides outstanding service to and builds relationships with over 100 customers everyday. 
**Candidates must be available to work 11AM-8PM, 12PM-9PM, 1PM-10PM or 3PM-Midnight during the week. Weekend and holidays required**
Detailed Description:
The Customer Service Associate position provides 'Simply the Best' customer service at all times.
In the Customer Service Associate role you will:
• Provide outstanding service to and builds relationships with over 100 customers every day
• Recognize cross-sell opportunities and refer customers to our Personal Banking team
• Work individually and as a team to meet and exceed established goals, ie. referral goals, call handle time goals, availability goals and quality goals
• Maintain up to date knowledge on Huntington products, services, technology, and procedures
• Compile documentation necessary for effectively fulfilling customer needs
• Document all notes required in the appropriate systems so that other colleagues can understand what has transpired with the customer's account
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
• Minimum of 1 year of customer service and sales experience required
• High School Diploma or equivalent required
• Candidates must be available to work 11AM-8PM, 12PM-9PM, 1PM-10PM or 3PM-Midnight during the week and at least one weekend day as part of their normal permanent schedule.
Other Traits, Qualifications and Experience
• Previous call center or banking experience preferred
• Ability to demonstrate professional verbal communication skills. Must pronunciate words clearly and use proper grammar 
• Ability to quickly resolve complex customer problems using various resources including computer screens and other reference material
• Ability to professionally handle irate customers
• Ability to use a headset and to sit for long periods of time
• Experience with Microsoft Office applications and the Internet
This position requires an assessment. The assessment will be emailed to candidates who meet the basic qualifications for the position.
Additional Details:
The Customer Service Associate position offers a competitive base salary with a performance based incentive program. In addition, our benefits meet a range of individual and family needs, including relaxation, financial protection and increasing security, both during your career and for retirement. Our comprehensive and versatile program is competitive with peer employers in our industry.

Brief Description:
The Teller is either, Part-time 1 (30-39 hours per week), Part - time 2 (20-29 hours per week), Part - time 3 (20 hours or less a week), or Part – time 4 ( 15 hour or less a week) , Monday thru Saturday. Provides high quality, accurate service to each customer every time. Processes customer transactions, accepts deposits, cash and non-cash transactions and cross-sells Bank products and services
Please apply for this position if you wish to be considered for potential openings at any of our Dayton/Springfield Branches.
**All of our communication is done via email. Please check your e-mail frequently for more information regarding the status of your application.
Detailed Description:
A Huntington Bank Teller provides “Simply the Best” customer service at all times.
· Personalizes each customer interaction while accurately processing banking transactions.
· Demonstrates excellent customer service by providing other general banking services, answering questions, and cross-selling Bank products and services, including referring customers to the sales team or other appropriate areas of the Bank.
· Meets and/or exceeds sales referral goals by understanding the customers' financial needs.
· Protects Huntington's assets by understanding and following policies and procedures, including balancing daily.
· Maintains customer confidentiality at all times.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
• High school diploma or GED is required
• Minimum of 6 months customer service
• Minimum of 6 months sales/referral experience that includes providing related products and service options to customers
• Minimum of 6 months cash handling
• Must receive a qualifying score on assessment measuring attention to detail, customer focus, ability to learn and apply procedures, sales focus, and cash handling/ balancing
Other Traits, Characteristics and Experience
· Must have excellent written and verbal (face-to-face and phone) communication skills including professional grammar and demeanor
· Must be available to work the required schedule of the Branch to include Saturdays
· Sales/referral experience that includes providing related products and service options to customers preferred
· Previous Teller experience is preferred
· Strong organizational skills with attention to detail
· Ability to multi-task
· Experience using computers
Additional Details:
Based on experience this position may be filled at a senior level.
Grade 67
The assessment will be emailed to candidates who meet the basic qualifications for the position.

Department Description:
Norton Branch
3580 Henry Street
Muskegon, MI 49441
Brief Description: Branch Manager, Full-time, including Saturday availability. Oversees day-to-day sales, operations & leadership within a specific branch. Builds and expands quality consumer & corporate customer relationships.
Detailed Description:
The Branch Manager provides 'Simply the Best' customer service and leadership at all times.
• Creates and executes goals for solidifying and gaining new consumer and business customer relationships.
• Conducts teleconsulting for the benefit of customers; cross-sells products; makes outside sales calls to solicit business.
• Sets clear expectations that lead to sales success for direct reports; drives, supports and achieves monthly sales quotas.
• Effectively resolves issues with clients/customers and associates.
• Establishes business contacts and networks through community relations activities.
• Sets clear expectations and measurable outcomes, while coaching and developing direct reports.
• Drives accountability and builds trust through character, connection, and competence.
• Demonstrates the ability to assess direct reports performance and behaviors effectively.
• Provides coaching, disciplinary actions and exits non-performers while adhering to company policies.
• Successfully recruits and hires the appropriate staff to deliver on expectations.
• Drives and coaches the customer service process and model of “Simply the Best” service.
• Understands the general principles of business and ensures operational efficiency as it relates to policies, procedures, compliance, loan accuracy, corporate audits, fee refunds, work schedules, forecasting, accuracy, and efficient operation.
• Complies with Bank security practices.
• Maintains customer confidentiality at all times.
Action Oriented – Is full of energy for the things he/she sees as interesting and challenging.
Building Effective Teams – Creates strong morale and spirit in his/her team.
Business Acumen - Understands how business works holistically.
Customer Focus - Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers.
Developing Direct Reports - Provides challenging and stretching tasks and assignments.
Directing Others - Is good at establishing clear direction.
Drive for Results - Can be counted on to successfully exceed goals.
Ethics and Values - Adheres to an appropriate and effective set of core values and beliefs during both favorable and challenging situations.
Integrity and Trust - Is seen as a direct and truthful individual.
Priority Setting - Spends his/her time and the time of others on the most critical needs of the business.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
• 3 years of Retail Banking sales experience with heavy emphasis on consumer and business development required
• Bachelor's degree in business-related major or equivalent of 2 years of successful sales management experience, preferably in financial services
• Must have excellent written and verbal (face-to-face and phone) communication skills including professional grammar and demeanor
• Intermediate PC proficiency
Other Traits, Characteristics and Experience
• Experience managing both a sales and operations team
• Demonstrated ability to coach and develop individuals and the team to high achievement in both sales and service
• Prefer proven success in meeting established sales and referral goals for banking products and services to include investment and insurance products
• Series 6 Securities license and Insurance License in good standing a plus
• Banking experience and community involvement in the local market helpful
• Strong organizational skills with attention to detail
• Ability to multi-task
Additional Details:
Grade 71
EOE/M/F/D/V
Huntington does not accept solicitation from Third Party Recruiters for any position.

The Branch Manager position provides 'Simply the Best' customer service and leadership at all times. The colleague in this position:

• Maintains knowledge and educates the office team on products, services, technology and policies. Ensures high quality, accurate customer service every time.

• Has a branch operations responsibility, such as ensuring that the team is trained and applying technology, policies and procedures.
• Complies with Bank security practices.
• Coaches, counsels, develops work schedules, is responsible for hiring, terminations, salary adjustments and/or disciplinary actions.
• Maintains customer confidentiality at all times.

Our Universal Bankers provide “Simply the Best” customer service to each customer every time, which includes being accurate, being available, making it easy for our customers and personalizing all customer interactions.
The person in this position:

• Researches customer inquiries and provides resolutions within Bank guidelines
• Responsible for maintaining up-to-date knowledge of products, services, technology, and regulations

• Maintains records, reports, and procedures required by the office
• Personalizes each customer interaction while accurately processing banking transactions, including balancing daily

• High school diploma or GED is required
• Minimum of 1-year of customer service and sales in banking, financial services or incentive driven retail sales required
• Minimum of 6 months cash handling
• Must receive a qualifying score on assessment measuring attention to detail, customer focus, ability to learn and apply procedures, sales focus, and cash handling/ balancing
Other Traits, Characteristics and Experience
• Experience working in a team environment and developing relationships
• Bachelor's degree in Business or a related field preferred
• Series 6 and state Insurance licenses preferred. Must obtain these licenses within a timeframe established by management
• Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills required
• Must have excellent written and verbal (face-to-face and phone) communication skills including professional grammar and demeanor
• Strong organizational skills with attention to detail
• Ability to multi-task

• Must display principles of core values - Teamwork, Accountability, Communication, Service, Diversity, and Passion

Department Description:
Mentor MallShopping Center - Float Position
7960 Plaza Blvd.
Mentor, Oh 44060
Brief Description:
Store Banking Specialist - Float position covering Mentor, Willoughby Hills, Mayfield, Lyndhurst stores - provides financial solutions using proactive, consultative sales skills to market bank products and services
Hours: Mon-Fri 8:00am-8:00pm Sat 8:00am-5:00pm Sun 10:00am-4:00pm
Detailed Description:
If you are an over achieving, high energy, passionate and ambitious sales person, Huntington is where you want to be! We are embarking on a new endeavor and are in need of expanding our sales team to deliver financial services that will enhance the lives of our customers, prospects and communities. In return for you hard work and success, we offer benefits you truly deserve: a lucrative incentive plan, the full spectrum of benefits and paid time off. We strongly encourage community involvement and participation in group events. If this describes you and meets your needs, “WELCOME TO HUNTINGTON!”
In this role,
· You will have the opportunity to change the lives of your customers, prospects, businesses and communities each day, by providing financial solutions using your proactive, consultative sales skills to market bank products and services in a branch location.
· You will surpass sales goals by uncovering and meeting the financial needs of customers, prospects, and businesses.
· Each day, you will have the opportunity to build relationships and do your best work, as you open new accounts, generate loans, sell and refer specialty products and resolve customer inquiries with a high performing team.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
· High school diploma or GED
· Minimum 1 year of successful and proven retail sales experience in a highly competitive incentive-driven environment
· Minimum of 6 months cash handling experience
· Ability to work a flexible full-time schedule during the following hours: 8:00am-8:00pm Mon-Fri, 8:00am-5:00pm Sat, and 10:00am-4:00pm Sun
Other Traits, Characteristics and Experience
· Bachelor's degree in Business or a related field preferred
· Series 6 and state Insurance licenses preferred
· Superior communication skills
· Professional demeanor
· Strong organizational skills, with attention to detail
· PC and internet proficiency
Additional Details:
Grade 68

Department Description: Business Banking, Westar Building, 440 Polaris Pkwy, Columbus, OH 43082
Brief Description: Develops and maintains profitable Business Banking relationships within a targeted market segment with revenue of $5 - $15 million by coordinating all sales and service efforts.
Detailed Description:
Develops and maintains profitable Business Banking relationships within a targeted market segment with revenue of $5 - $15 million by coordinating all sales and service efforts. Responsible for developing revenue growth through generation of loan, deposits and cross selling all applicable bank products and services to existing customer base. Responsible for soliciting a wide variety of commercial loans and lines of credit and typically handles the most complex accounts, large credit exposures and sensitive client relationships. Following credit policy, makes decisions on structure and underwriting of commercial loans with minimum credit authority of up to $5mm. 
Adheres to bank policies and procedures and complies with legal and regulatory requirements. Accountable for risk management, compliance and audit performance for area(s) of responsibility whether a supervisor, manager or individual contributor. Establishes or works with management to develop effective controls and processes to ensure risks are measured, monitored and controlled and compliance requirements are adhered to on an on-going basis. If applicable, ensures staff is properly trained, provided with appropriate resources and motivated to adhere to risk management principles. Maintains current knowledge of risk-related changes that may impact assigned area(s) of responsibility.
Job Requirements:
• Bacherlor's Degree
• 5-7 related experience
Additional Details:
Grade 73
EOE/M/F/D/V

Department Description:
IT-Retail & Business Banking
Easton Business Service Center
Columbus, OH 43219
Brief Description: Business Systems Analyst Senior – Responsible for delivering functionality within the Cards and ATM portfolio that meets the needs of the external and internal customers.
Detailed Description: Responsible for delivering functionality within the Cards and ATM portfolio that meets the needs of the external and internal customers. Collaborates with product management and business areas to facilitate and define scope and business requirements. May have additional responsibilities for quality assurance testing and rollout of new functionality. Ensures delivered functionality meets business area goals and objectives. Adheres to the System Development Life Cycle.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in a technically related field of study 
• Must have at least 5 years of progressively responsible experience as a Business Analyst or similar professional position. 
• Must have at least 5 years of experience developing requirements, test plans, test scripts and managing projects. 
• Must work effectively in a team environment and possess strong commitment to the team and the client. Must have previous experience facilitating meetings/discussion groups related to requirements definition, issue resolution, and process improvement. 
• Previous management experience is preferred.
Other Traits and Characteristics
· Experience with Debit or Credit Card applications a plus
· Strong communication, facilitation and elicitation skills
· Sound planning and organization skills
· Proficient understanding of business systems and industry requirements
· Knowledge of creating Process Flow Diagrams, Data Requirements & Requirements Traceability Matrix
· Knowledge of writing/understanding detailed Use Cases
· Knowledge of evaluating system impacts as result of changes and regression testing
· May work with the QA Team to review test plan, test cases and validate test scripts to ensure requirements are thoroughly tested. Defect management experience a plus
· Proficient in use of Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, FrontPage and Visio)
· Working knowledge of project management methodologies
Additional Details:
Grade 72
EOE M/F/D/V

Department Description:
Aurora Rd Solon Center - Float Position34310 Aurora Rd.
Solon, OH 44139
Brief Description:
Store Banking Specialist - Float position covering Solon, Maple Heights, City View, Chagrin stores - provides financial solutions using proactive, consultative sales skills to market bank products and services
Hours: Mon-Fri 8:00am-8:00pm Sat 8:00am-5:00pm Sun 10:00am-4:00pm
Detailed Description:
If you are an over achieving, high energy, passionate and ambitious sales person, Huntington is where you want to be! We are embarking on a new endeavor and are in need of expanding our sales team to deliver financial services that will enhance the lives of our customers, prospects and communities. In return for you hard work and success, we offer benefits you truly deserve: a lucrative incentive plan, the full spectrum of benefits and paid time off. We strongly encourage community involvement and participation in group events. If this describes you and meets your needs, “WELCOME TO HUNTINGTON!”
In this role,
· You will have the opportunity to change the lives of your customers, prospects, businesses and communities each day, by providing financial solutions using your proactive, consultative sales skills to market bank products and services in a branch location.
· You will surpass sales goals by uncovering and meeting the financial needs of customers, prospects, and businesses.
· Each day, you will have the opportunity to build relationships and do your best work, as you open new accounts, generate loans, sell and refer specialty products and resolve customer inquiries with a high performing team.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
· High school diploma or GED
· Minimum 1 year of successful and proven retail sales experience in a highly competitive incentive-driven environment
· Minimum of 6 months cash handling experience
· Ability to work a flexible full-time schedule during the following hours: 8:00am-8:00pm Mon-Fri, 8:00am-5:00pm Sat, and 10:00am-4:00pm Sun
Other Traits, Characteristics and Experience
· Bachelor's degree in Business or a related field preferred
· Series 6 and state Insurance licenses preferred
· Superior communication skills
· Professional demeanor
· Strong organizational skills, with attention to detail
· PC and internet proficiency
Additional Details:
Grade 68 
Based on experience this position may be filled at a senior level.
EOE/M/F/D/V
Huntington does not accept solicitation from Third Party Recruiters for any position.

• Using consultative selling techniques, analyzes and provides solutions for clients' financial needs. Makes sales referrals to specialized areas of the Bank based on customer need.

Department Description:
Risk Management Group-Operational Risk Group
Huntington Center
41 S. High Street
Columbus, OH 43215
Brief Description:
Risk Management Systems Specialist. Full-time, Monday - Friday, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM.
Risk Management Systems Specialist Position in the Risk Management Group will be responsible for managing the design, implementation, and support functions related to an Enterprise Wide Risk Management(EWRM) Solution based on the Archer Software Suite. Additionally, position will assist in risk analytic activities related to analysis, monitoring, tracking and reporting of risks identified within the EWRM Solution and the Risk Management Group.
Detailed Description:
Risk Management Systems Specialist Position is responsible for managing the support functions
related to the Enterprise Wide Risk Management (EWRM) Solution based on the Archer Software Suite.
The functions include:
· Managing the design, implementation, and improvements to the functions of the software platform
· Improving and managing user functionality; participating in vendor participant groups, capturing, analyzing, addressing and presenting feedback from users.
· Business segment training on the Archer EWRM Solution
· Administering a help desk function for the software solution
· Risk analytics may include analysis and reporting activities related to non-credit losses, key risk indicators/metrics, policies, policy exceptions, and risk assessments.
· Position may serve as a liaison for internal and external exams as required.
· Position will encompass working on special projects that result from testing, risk assessments, user feedback or management committee issues.
· Additionally, a certification for the EWRM Solution will be required within 120 days from the date of hire.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
• Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Accounting or Computer Information Systems with an emphasis in business.
• Demonstrate at least 5 years of experience in an operational or support environment that required independent analysis, assessment and resolution of moderately complex issues.
• Hands on experience with databases to include retrieval and reporting of information.
• Experience with the identification, establishment, testing and reporting of business controls.
Other Traits and Characteristics:
• Demonstrate excellent analytical skills, strong attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines and a commitment to quality assurance in work produced.
• Must possess strong working knowledge of applications within Microsoft Office Suite.
• Must be able to work as part of a team to resolve issues and meet deadlines.
• Demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Ability to lead team in a project management role.
• Previous experience interacting with internal or external auditors or regulatory agencies.
• Experience in report writing capabilities such as Cognos
• Experience with the Archer Suite of Risk Management Solutions is desired
Additional Details:
