Department Description:
Holland Call Center
This high volume sales and service position will allow you to engage your customer service skills by delivering prompt and accurate answers to telephone banking customers while identifying new opportunities and solutions. 
**Candidates must be available to work Part-Time hours 20-29 hrs/wk or 30-39 hrs/wk 5:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m and either Saturday or Sunday. Weekend and holidays are required**
Brief Description:
Customer Service Associate, Part-Time--20-29 hrs/wk or 30-39 hrs/wk. Works individually and as a team to meet and exceed established sales and service goals. Provides outstanding service to and builds relationships with over 100 customers everyday. 
**Candidates must be available to work Part-Time hours 20-29 hrs/wk or 30-39 hrs/wk 5:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m and either Saturday or Sunday. Weekend and holidays are required**
Detailed Description:
The Customer Service Associate provides 'Simply the Best' customer service at all times.
In the Customer Service Associate role you will:
• Provide outstanding service to and builds relationships with over 100 customers every day
• Recognize cross-sell opportunities and refer customers to our Personal Banking team
• Work individually and as a team to meet and exceed established goals, ie. referral goals, call handle time goals, availability goals and quality goals
• Maintain up to date knowledge on Huntington products, services, technology, and procedures
• Compile documentation necessary for effectively fulfilling customer needs
• Document all notes required in the appropriate systems so that other colleagues can understand what has transpired with the customer's account
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
• Minimum of 1 year of customer service and sales experience required
• High School Diploma or equivalent required
• Candidates must be available to work Part-Time hours 5PM-9PM during the week and at least one weekend day as part of their normal permanent schedule.
Other Traits, Qualifications and Experience
• Previous call center or banking experience preferred
• Ability to demonstrate professional verbal communication skills. Must pronunciate words clearly and use proper grammar 
• Ability to quickly resolve complex customer problems using various resources including computer screens and other reference material
• Ability to professionally handle irate customers
• Ability to use a headset and to sit for long periods of time
• Experience with Microsoft Office applications and the Internet
This position requires an assessment. The assessment will be emailed to candidates who meet the basic qualifications for the position.
Additional Details:
The Customer Service Associate position offers a competitive base salary with a performance based incentive program. In addition, our benefits meet a range of individual and family needs, including relaxation, financial protection and increasing security, both during your career and for retirement. Our comprehensive and versatile program is competitive with peer employers in our industry.

Department Description:
HBI Corporate Offices
41 South High Street
Columbus, OH 43215
Current vacancy is located in Columbus, OH, however candidates in other Ohio metropolitan markets will be considered.
Brief Description: Credit Review Specialist. Full-time. An opening exists in HBI’s Credit Review Department for a Credit Review Specialist. HBI Credit Review’s mission is to independently evaluate the quality of the assets which incur varying levels of credit risk for the institution. Credit Review evaluates and reports on the effectiveness of the credit processes that produce and monitor these assets which include Commercial loans and leases. Candidates must have strong credit and technology skills and 5-10 years of commercial credit experience, ability to effectively communicate both orally and written and be able to work both independently and as part of a team.
Detailed Description:
The incumbent is responsible for the following activities for portfolios assigned:(1) be a risk management resource to the business unit(s) assigned, (2) Interface with both staff and senior management of the business unit(s), (3) independently lead the review of its credit portfolios and credit processes and write a report of findings, (4) provide HBI senior management with information regarding the business unit and the quality of its portfolio. A Senior Credit Review Specialist will typically be assigned more complex units and tasks and will be expected to be a leader for special projects that may be assigned.
The individual will be expected to attend credit quality meetings with the business unit credit staff as well as attend problem loan meetings (CARS) for the portfolio. Will review the credit transactions and rate the quality of underwriting, due diligence, structuring, and Credit Policy compliance in the credit granting process. Also, the incumbent will recommend assigned ratings on the portfolio management process (i.e. monitoring and risk assignments by the units' staff).
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
• Bachelor's Degree required.
• 5-10 years experience in complex C&I underwriting and analysis required.
• Completed formal credit training.
Other Traits and Characteristics
• Must have strong technology and people skills.
• Must be a self starter communicate well (both orally and written), be able to 'think outside the box' and be creative in finding solutions to issues and problems that develop from time to time.
• Meeting deadlines is a must, as is a sense of urgency in meeting department and personal goals.
Additional Details:
Grade 71.
EOE/M/F/D/V

Clarksburg Office
230 West Pike Street
Clarksburg, WV26301
Brief Description: Create and execute effective marketing strategies leading to the acquisition and retention of targeted Huntington commercial banking prospects and clients within defined market territories. Develop and maintain profitable client relationships working with Portfolio Managers, Treasury Management Specialists, and various other Product Partners.
Detailed Description:
Business Development & Sales: With highest priority given to clients and prospects, relationship managers will proactively identify problems/solutions and deliver Simply the Best Service through disciplined strategies and processes.
• Establish and maintain prospect list for assigned territories. Creation and execution of weekly marketing letter campaign with goal of issuing and following up on 10-15 letters per week.
• Be capable of flexing to audience and clearly articulate HNB value proposition.
• Produce Weekly Goals for discussion and execution with Sales Team Leader. Submit results on Friday.
• Form and execute practical client entertainment strategies ensuring tangible return is generated from investment of time. Assist in the development and retention of existing clients through effective client relationship development plans.
• Coordinate and implement on boarding process with each new IHC.
• Obtain at least 2 referrals (with goal of 3) from existing clients during the year.
• Lead / prepare proposals, term sheets, and preview memos. Lead the presentation of all preview and approval meetings.
• Transfer call information and review CRISP Pipeline information to assure accuracy to/with Sales Associate on Weekly basis.
• Attend, be engaged, and execute action steps coming from Weekly Sales Meetings.
Product Knowledge: Have enough knowledge to be conversant about all the commercial products, ask basic questions, take initiative to learn, and pull in the proper resources when needed.
• Understands features and benefits of core commercial products
• Ability to convert benefits into solutions for the customer
• Understanding of essential partner product set
• Understands pricing, including cost/benefit analysis
• Ability to differentiate HNB’s products from competitors
Leadership and Partner Integration: Leadership is a skill that facilitates proactive decision making such that the account executive is motivated and disciplined to set challenging goals, while eager to improve those around them.
· Established personal goals to purposely stretch skills and abilities
· Ability to motivate and empower relationship team members
· Coach/Mentor other CBD members within and across teams to help them develop
· Ability to make timely decisions
· Delegates tasks to the appropriate team members
· Involvement with professional network to be visible to subordinates and management
· Active participation in HNB sponsored events
· Participation in community events, serving on local boards, demonstrating Huntington support for the local community.
Technology: Integration of current technologies is essential for relationship managers to readily track portfolios and deliver prompt responses to both customers and Essential Partners.
· Effective utilization of CRISP
· Effective utilization of Lotus Notes
· Effective utilization of Excel and Word applications
· Effective utilization of online industry tools
Living the Huntington Values: Represent, communicate, endorse, and behave according to Huntington’s Vision and Values in your daily activity. These include the following:
· Teamwork
· Communication
· Accountability
· Passion
· Diversity
· Service

• 3-5 years experience as a Commercial Relationship Manager or Sales Executive with proven sales experience in a calling environment
• Bachelor’s degree is required
• Demonstrated consistent and effective negotiation skills
• Sound judgment in handling all aspects of customer relationships
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, along with a high level of professionalism
• Demonstrated knowledge of credit structure, along with thorough understanding of current banking and capital markets

Detailed Description:
In this role, you will be expected to:
· Manage 8-10 Large Corporate relationship managers in multiple markets by directing business development efforts and allocating resources, as appropriate, to accomplish the stated financial objectives, within the stated risk profile.
· Manage revenue producing activities of relationship managers, such as: generating loans and deposits and cross-selling the bank’s other products and services.
· Assist and participate in business development efforts by calling on clients, prospects and centers of influence in applicable markets.
· Development of marketing strategies to meet established goals for loan growth, deposit growth, and fee income
· Risk management, compliance, and audit performance, as it relates to your scope of influence as team leader.

· Continually evaluating strategic direction and risks against the backdrop of economic, technological, competitive, regulatory, and other environmental changes

· Strong Business Development skills
· Strong knowledge/experience with sophisticated large corporate products/services
· Ability to use teamwork to resolve issues and collaborate with others
· Proven problem solving skills to handle complex issues
· Ability to effectively communicate with all levels of management

Department Description:
IT-Information Security
Easton Business Service Center
Columbus, OH 43219
Brief Description: Anti-Fraud Architect is responsible for monitoring the effectiveness of security and fraud control structure across the enterprise, and developing and coordinating fraud prevention/detection/mitigation strategies in partnership with business segment frontline and back-room fraud teams.
Detailed Description:
Primary roles and responsibilities include:
· Coordinates technology and business process enhancement initiatives to improve fraud controls, in conjunction with impacted business segment risk, product management, and operational teams, as well as other stakeholders including technical teams, Information Security, Corporate Investigations, AML/BSA, Legal, Internal Audit, Corporate Risk Management, and Corporate Compliance.
· Leads security and fraud architecture activities particularly as they relate to enterprise wide solutions in authentication, authorization, and other areas.
· Advises business segments with regard to implementing and enhancing fraud prevention and detection processes and controls.
· Performs risk assessments and provides input on fraud risk and controls to support business segment risk officers in conjunction with the business segment control self-testing and periodic risk and controls self-assessment processes.
· Analyzes fraud risk related to new products and services and changes to existing products and services.
· Evaluates new fraud and security related technologies.
· Escalates issues to senior management in a timely and accurate manner.
· Assists in Crisis Incident Management events as necessary.
Adheres to bank policies and procedures and complies with legal and regulatory requirements. Accountable for risk management, compliance and audit performance for area(s) of responsibility whether a supervisor, manager or individual contributor. Establishes or works with management to develop effective controls and processes to ensure risks are measured, monitored and controlled and compliance requirements are adhered to on an on-going basis. If applicable, ensures staff is properly trained, provided with appropriate resources and motivated to adhere to risk management principles. Maintains current knowledge of risk-related changes that may impact assigned area(s) of responsibility.
Job Requirements:
• Bachelor’s degree in a technically related field of study.
• 5 to 7 years of progressively responsible risk, audit, compliance, or operational experience, with experience in the areas of fraud risk prevention, mitigation and/or investigation.
• Detailed knowledge of fraud risks and control strategies related to at least one of the following banking delivery/payment channels: call center, debit card, credit card, deposit/check processing, online banking, commercial payments (Wire, ACH) cash management services, mortgage, direct consumer lending/HELOC, indirect consumer lending, business banking and commercial lending, trust.
• In depth knowledge of risk management procedures and principles.
• Project management experience.
• Data analysis experience.
Additional Details:
Grade 73
EOE M/F/D/V

Department Description: Treasury Management
Brief Description: Treasury Management Middle Market Sales Advisor. Fulltime. Responsible for identifying Treasury Management opportunities with prospects and clients.
Detailed Description: Huntington’s Large Corporate team manages financial relationships with companies maintaining revenues in excess of $500 million, including many large national retailers, insurance agencies and manufacturing companies. The ideal candidate will possess detailed knowledge with retail payment strategies and products. Through consultative, needs-based selling, the Large Corporate Treasury Management Sales Advisor is responsible for identifying Treasury Management sales opportunities with both prospects and clients. Position duties include independent Treasury Management sales prospecting, cross-selling to existing clients, product pricing and account structuring, proposal creation and presentation, and performing client reviews. Through a strong partnership with Relationship Bankers, the Sales Advisor carries out market, portfolio, and deposit strategies while identifying cross-sell opportunities for other lines of business. The Sales Advisor must stay current on competitor offerings, and provide market and competitor feedback to ensure competitiveness. Cross sells other bank products, and stays current on competitor offerings to suggest product improvements.
Job Requirements:
A minimum of 5 years in Large Corporate Treasury Management Sales or Commercial Lending, with a specialization in managing large national retailers, is required. 
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent (7 years of Treasury Management sales experience) is required. 
CTP designation is also required.
Other Traits and Qualifications:
• Advanced sales, negotiation, and communication skills required. 
• Knowledge of bank products and continual development of product expertise is a must. 
• Ability to develop working relationships with individuals at all levels of an organization. 
• Excellent communication skills both verbal and written. 
• Excellent organizational skills. 
• Knowledge of Microsoft Office required.
Additional Details:
Grade 73

An Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V

• Using consultative selling techniques, analyzes and provides solutions for clients' financial needs. Makes sales referrals to specialized areas of the Bank based on customer need.
• Proactively seeks out current and potential clients for sales and customer service opportunities through calling activities and use of marketing resources.
• Works with banking office team members to achieve individual and banking office sales goals by opening new accounts, taking loan applications and closing loans
• Researches customer inquiries and provides resolutions within Bank guidelines.
• Responsible for maintaining up-to-date knowledge of products, services, technology, and regulations.
• Complies with internal security policies and procedures and maintains customer confidentiality at all times.
• Maintains records, reports, and procedures required by the office.

• High school diploma or GED is required
• Minimum of 1-year of customer service and sales in banking, financial services or incentive driven retail sales required
Other Traits, Characteristics and Experience
• Must have excellent written and verbal (face-to-face and phone) communications skills, to include professional grammar and demeanor
• Experience working in a team environment and developing relationships
• PC and Internet proficiency
• Bachelor's degree in Business or a related field preferred
• Series 6 and state Insurance licenses preferred. Must obtain these licenses within a timeframe established by management
• Proven organizational skills with attention to detail
• The ability to multi-task

Based on experience this position may be hired at the senior level.
Grade 68

Department Description:
The Huntington National Bank
7 Easton Oval
Columbus, OH 43219
Brief Description: Investigator’s handle alerts pertaining to credit, non-credit, and money laundering, within diversified bank wide operations spanning multiple lines of businesses.
Detailed Description:
Reviews and analyses suspicious activity on alerts generated by the Bank’s anti-money laundering software system and other alert systems in accordance with regulatory expectations. 
Completes pre-assigned tasks and specific projects such as reviewing all high risk transactions for a specific customer. 
Performs drill down investigations on high risk activities. 
Proven ability to identify potential concerns, analyze and solve problems. 
Provides support and works with business segments that are reporting potential suspicious activity. 
Assists in preparation of various reports. 
Develops close working relationship with Departmental Mangers to assist in identifying trends in suspicious activity. 
Maintain work at department quality standards. Flexible to perform other functions as requested by management.
Adheres to bank policies and procedures and complies with legal and regulatory requirements. 
Follows, or in some cases establishes, as required, effective controls and processes to ensure risks are measured, monitored and controlled and compliance requirements are adhered to on an on-going basis. 
Keeps abreast of risk-related changes that may impact assigned work functions and processes.
Job Requirements:
Education
· High School Diploma or GED equivalent
· Bachelor’s Degree preferred
Experience
• 2 years AML Operations experience
· Investigation experience preferred
· Professional certification (i.e. CAMS, CFE) preferred
Skills and Abilities
· Ability to work in a fast paced, high pressure environment with professionalism, courtesy and tact
· Ability to shift priorities as needed to meet demand
· Basic PC skills - MS Word, Excel, web based applications
· Utilize multiple bank systems concurrently
· Excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication skills
· Professional attitude
· Strong attention to detail
· Self motivated, deadline driven and able to work in an ever changing environment
Additional Details:
Grade 70
EOE/M/F/D/V

Department Description: Position filled in Grand Rapids, Michigan however travel will be required.
Brief Description: This dynamic, high-energy individual will plan, prepare, and facilitate sales, service, technical, and soft skills training. Responsibilities will also include consulting with line of business managers to determine the need for individual training and facilitating, mentoring, and providing follow up coaching and feedback as necessary. He or she will also participate in the design process as needed. Maintaining up-to-date knowledge of technology, products, policies and procedures is critical to success in this position. Regular day and multiple night travel within Huntington’s footprint will be required.
Detailed Description: Designs, organizes, and/or conducts specialized training for assigned areas or functions of the company. Maintains records of training activities and monitors employee progress. Maintains up-to-date knowledge of products, policies, and procedures as needed to provide effective training. Communicates with managers and others to assess training needs. Establishes training goals and measures effectiveness of training programs.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
- Internal candidates should have a good foundation of sales
- External candidates must have 3 years experience in delivery of adult education/training programs, preferably in a financial services environment preferred
- Demonstrated competency in training delivery and facilitation
Other Traits and Characteristics
- Superior communication and presentation skills
- Demonstrated project management skills
- Proficiency with MS Office applications
- Ability to travel regularly,locally and overnight as well as throughout the Huntington footprint
- Experience in financial services, particularly in a sales oriented role preferred
Additional Details:
During the interview process, candidates will be asked to make a presentation to display their ability to be actively engaging, able to interact with all levels of associates, and build rapport with an audience.
Grade 71
An Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V Travel will be required

Department Description:
Hamilton Branch
4677 Washington St.
Hamilton, MI 49419
Brief Description: Branch Manager, Full-time, including Saturday availability. Oversees day-to-day sales, operations & leadership within a specific branch. Builds and expands quality consumer & corporate customer relationships.
Detailed Description:
The Branch Manager provides 'Simply the Best' customer service and leadership at all times.
• Creates and executes goals for solidifying and gaining new consumer and business customer relationships.
• Conducts teleconsulting for the benefit of customers; cross-sells products; makes outside sales calls to solicit business.
• Sets clear expectations that lead to sales success for direct reports; drives, supports and achieves monthly sales quotas.
• Effectively resolves issues with clients/customers and associates.
• Establishes business contacts and networks through community relations activities.
• Sets clear expectations and measurable outcomes, while coaching and developing direct reports.
• Drives accountability and builds trust through character, connection, and competence.
• Demonstrates the ability to assess direct reports performance and behaviors effectively.
• Provides coaching, disciplinary actions and exits non-performers while adhering to company policies.
• Successfully recruits and hires the appropriate staff to deliver on expectations.
• Drives and coaches the customer service process and model of “Simply the Best” service.
• Understands the general principles of business and ensures operational efficiency as it relates to policies, procedures, compliance, loan accuracy, corporate audits, fee refunds, work schedules, forecasting, accuracy, and efficient operation.
• Complies with Bank security practices.
• Maintains customer confidentiality at all times.
Action Oriented – Is full of energy for the things he/she sees as interesting and challenging.
Building Effective Teams – Creates strong morale and spirit in his/her team.
Business Acumen - Understands how business works holistically.
Customer Focus - Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers.
Developing Direct Reports - Provides challenging and stretching tasks and assignments.
Directing Others - Is good at establishing clear direction.
Drive for Results - Can be counted on to successfully exceed goals.
Ethics and Values - Adheres to an appropriate and effective set of core values and beliefs during both favorable and challenging situations.
Integrity and Trust - Is seen as a direct and truthful individual.
Priority Setting - Spends his/her time and the time of others on the most critical needs of the business.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
• 3 years of Retail Banking sales experience with heavy emphasis on consumer and business development required
• Bachelor's degree in business-related major or equivalent of 2 years of successful sales management experience, preferably in financial services
• Must have excellent written and verbal (face-to-face and phone) communication skills including professional grammar and demeanor
• Intermediate PC proficiency
Other Traits, Characteristics and Experience
• Experience managing both a sales and operations team
• Demonstrated ability to coach and develop individuals and the team to high achievement in both sales and service
• Prefer proven success in meeting established sales and referral goals for banking products and services to include investment and insurance products
• Series 6 Securities license and Insurance License in good standing a plus
• Banking experience and community involvement in the local market helpful
• Strong organizational skills with attention to detail
• Ability to multi-task
Additional Details:
Grade 71
EOE/M/F/D/V
Huntington does not accept solicitation from Third Party Recruiters for any position.

Department Description:
Huntington Bank
Capital Markets – Foreign Exchange
7 Easton Oval
Columbus, Ohio
Brief Description: Business Analyst 2. Fulltime, Monday - Friday, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM. Reporting to the Foreign Exchange Operations Manager, this is a high profile role with significant exposure to management and business users. The Foreign Exchange business has agreed on a list of key deliverables for 2011 and beyond. The Business Analayst is required to take the ownership of the projects, assigned modules within a project, status reporting, project documentation, stakeholder communication, testing, procedure development and training.
Detailed Description:
The Business Analyst is required to liaise with business and IT groups to understand business requirements and manage both internal and external expectations.
The main responsibilities include requirements gathering, liaison with technical and business staff, documentation, application testing and defect management, process mapping and procedure writing
The Business Analyst will play a central role in the success of key projects.
The Business Analyst is also responsible for managing deliverables on each project undertaken, ensuring that all deadlines are met and any issues escalated appropriately. In his/her role, individual would be recognized as a Business / product expert.
Key Responsibilities
• Liaison with business users and clients to understand requirements, issues and concerns.
• Drive and own projects to completion
• Production of formal documentation detailing business and functional requirements.
• Management and execution of software testing process.
• Providing business support for all relevant systems.
• Maintaining exceptional customer service levels.
• Production of formal testing plans and test cases as well as procedures.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
• High School Diploma or GED equivalent required.
• At least 3-5 years of experience working as a business analyst within Financial Services, ideally on Capital Markets Products.
• Exceptional analytical and organizational skills. Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently.
• Good understanding of Foreign Exchange Products – Spot/Forwards, Swaps, Time Options, OTC Options and also Interest Rate Products, Hedges, Corporate Bonds, Commercial Paper and commodities.
• Strong experience of using and/or supporting front-office trading applications.
• Strong documentation skills. Must be able to clearly organize and document user requirements into formal Business Requirements, Functional Requirements and System specifications.
• Excellent information gathering skills, written and verbal communication skills.
• Thorough understanding of formal Software Development Life Cycle Practices.
• Experience in implementing counterparty credit check pertaining to pre-deal/intra/post-trade credit check, haircut, margin, exposure calculations etc. a plus.
• Strong process mapping and procedure writing skills.
• Experience on E-commerce trading platforms a plus.
• Good understanding of Oracle, SQL, Crystal Reports WallStreet Systems knowledge preferred.
Additional Details:
Salary Grade 70
EOE M/F/D/V
Huntington does not accept solicitations from Third Party Recruiters

The Senior Auditor will be exposed to various businesses and functions within the organization and in-charge the planning, execution and reporting of audit engagements. Audits will be performed in accordance with department and professional standards. The Senior Auditor will interact with various operational, compliance, financial and IT Auditors while performing their responsibilities. Specific audit responsibilities will involve planning and executing control and substantive testing and evaluating audit results to determine if issues exist and improvement recommendations are necessary. Performance of audit procedures and documentation of results requires the Senior Auditor candidate to have strong verbal and written communication skills, as well as the ability to supervise staff, monitor audit engagement progress and interact with management when in-charging.

· Strong verbal and written communication skills
· Comfortable working in a team environment and supervising staff
· Strong analytical skills
· Ability to meet deadlines
· Three or more years of audit experience
· Professional certification (CIA, CPA, CFE, etc.) or progress toward certification preferred
· Knowledge of banking regulations preferred
· Working knowledge of Excel and Word, with Lotus Notes, Access, ACL or Visio knowledge a plus
· Potential to travel (approximately 10%)

Brief Description: The Compliance Section Manager (CSM) oversees all ongoing activities related to the development, implementation, review, maintenance of, and adherence to, the compliance policies and procedures of Huntington Bancshares Incorporated and its subsidiaries (HBI). The CSM is responsible for identifying, advising and monitoring for compliance issues, concerns, and deficiencies for HBI. This position reports to the Trust/Fiduciary Compliance Group Manager (CGM)

Duties for this position include completing and distributing periodic risk assessments, monitoring, development of testing, serving as a liaison to external and internal auditors, and communicating the following to business segments and senior and executive management: regulatory issuances, changes and guidance, policy exceptions, and compliance issues.
This position supports Huntington’s fiduciary and investment business which consists of 5 business segments: Derivatives, FX, Mezzanine, and Huntington Asset Services. Responsibilities of the Fiduciary/Investment CSM span the scope of these business segments.
This position will also be responsible for performing other duties and projects as assigned by the Trust/Fiduciary CGM.

Department Description:
Huntington Works Specialist
This position will be located somewhere in the Mahoning Valley area (north PA, north MV or south MV), depending on the candidate.
Brief Description: Huntington Works Specialist, Full-time, Monday-Friday. Develops profitable Huntington at Work relationships with prospective small business/corporate clients. Facilitates sale of basic & specialty bank products to their employees.
Detailed Description: Develops profitable, full service retail financial relationships by establishing a Huntington at Work relationship/commitment with prospective small business and corporate clients. Facilitates the sale of basic and specialty HNB retail products to their employees. Responsibilities include identifying prospective clients, making presentations to company management regarding HNB products and meeting with their employees in order to provide them with retail product information, determine their needs, and recommend and cross sell all bank products and services. May open accounts, complete applications, coordinate with banking office staff to sell products and services, or refer to other bank areas. Must spend most of the time on external sales calls and business development. Sales will have a retail focus, however, building relationships with commercial and business banking partners will be critical to success in order to earn introductions to potential clients.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
· Bachelor's Degree required (10 or more years of retail banking sales and product experience may substitute for degree)
· Minimum 3-5 years of successful retail banking office sales. This will include business development experience working with Retail and Business Banking clients and products to include prospecting, cold calling, and cross selling is required.
· In depth retail banking product knowledge
· Highly developed customer service and sales skills are required with an emphasis on delivering 'Simply the Best' service to internal and external customers
Other Traits, Characteristics and Experience
· Will be customer and relationship focused, energetic and goal driven, as well as be able to relate well to all kinds of people.
· Experience and comfort level presenting one-on-one and in groups, working successfully with multiple lines of business and working effectively in a team environment are key skills needed.
· Must have used knowledge of business trends and their effect on the market to implement strategies and tactics in the marketplace.
· Must be able to manage time well, work independently, and possess ability to work in a multi-task environment
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills are critical in this high profile position as well as the projection of professionalism, and the ability to influence, overcome objections and close a sale.
· Must be proficient in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and other MS office applications
Huntington associates share values that define the way we work, these include: Teamwork, Communication, Accountability, Service, Diversity and Passion.
Simply the Best service is a key value. Positive customer experiences, internal and external, are what drive our company’s success. We believe that people not products are what make our company great. Each associate contributes to our success by consistently displaying the following “Simply the Best” service behaviors in each interaction with a customer.
Do it accurately -produce accurate work and get the details right.
Be available -meet customer’s expectations for service and provide timely response to all requests.
Make it easy -take proactive steps to simplify all customer interactions, making it easy for them to do business with Huntington.
Personalize it -personalize the service delivered:
Read the situation and listen -look at everything from the customer’s perspective.
Customize the solution -respond to customer’s specific needs.
Own and deliver -provide the best solution to meet customer’s needs.
Additional Details:
Grade 71
An Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V
Huntington does not accept solicitation from Third Party Recruiters for any position

Department Description:
Credit Administration
41 S. High Street
Columbus, OH
Brief Description: Segment Risk Officer is responsible for the development and oversight of Huntington's risk management protocols from an operational, reputational, financial (SOX 404), and credit risk perspective in the Credit Administration business segment.
Detailed Description:
Develops, recommends and administers risk management processes and procedures for Credit Administration, Collections, Special Assets and Special Servicing and other key areas within the segment, ensuring internal controls are operating effectively. Work with the business segment to ensure overall risk function is effectively supporting strategic goals to include analyzing risks related to new products and services. Monitors pertinent key risk indicators and investigates and reports on adverse movements in risk within the segment. Responsible for corporate governance functions with the segment. Member of the bank-wide enterprise risk committee. Manages a team of internal control, quality control and risk management related functions within the segment.
Self monitoring and testing – Implements and maintains appropriate independent testing and control monitoring that is both accurate and timely, in accordance with corporate risk guidance for sample size, frequency and documentation.
Issues management – Ensures all issues pertaining to Credit, i.e., self-identified, regulatory, internal/external auditor or corporate credit review, are resolved within established timeframes and that remedial actions are monitored to prevent recurrence
Drives risk culture – Establishes expectations, ownership and accountability for risk management within the business segment that includes reinforcement and education.
Exam management – Serves as the liaison for all examination related activities pertaining to the business segment, including regulatory, internal/external audit and corporate loan review. Coordinates regulatory and internal audit examination activity, ensuring appropriate responses are implemented.
Policies, procedures, laws, rules and regulations – Facilitates Credit Administration’s adherence to corporate and business unit policies and procedures through testing, validation and oversight, i.e., vendor management, business continuity.
Risk Awareness and Escalation - Continuously monitors all sources of risk existing within business segment to include credit, market, operational, regulatory, reputational, strategic and emerging risks. Elevates risk issues and potential solutions to senior management within the segment as well as the corporation.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
· Bachelors degree required in Business or Finance.
· 7+ years of progressively responsible experience in Credit Administration with a high level of involvement with risk management.
· 5+ years Operational Risk/Audit Experience
· In depth business segment knowledge and expertise that translates into effective operational risk practices, processes and procedures
· Refined leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills.
· Excellent influencing, consultative and organizational skills.
Other Traits and Characteristics:
• Ability to educate and drive cultural awareness of effective risk management
• Operational and risk management experience preferred
• Demonstrated success in creating effective risk management programs and processes in accordance with internal standards and regulatory requirements.
• Credit experience preferred
• Excellent influencing, consulting and communication skills.
Additional Details:
Grade 75
EOE M/F/D/V

Department Description:
Huntington National Bank
41 S. High Street
Columbus, OH 43287
Brief Description: Full-time Corporate Accounting position to lead a Quality Assurance function focusing on Huntington’s regulatory financial reporting processes.
Detailed Description: Corporate Accounting is seeking a highly motivated individual to develop testing plans, execute, and report on the completeness and accuracy of our Regulatory Financial Reports including the quarterly FR Y-9C, Y-9LP and Call Report, the weekly FR 2900 report, and the annual FR Y-6, among others. The successful candidate will manage a team of quality assurance specialists and will interact with various functions and business segments including Corporate Accounting, Finance, and Treasury. Specific responsibilities will involve planning and executing control and substantive testing and evaluating results to determine if systemic issues exist and process improvements are necessary. The successful candidate will collaborate with the Regulatory Reporting Department and other personnel to assist in the implementation of any necessary corrective actions. Performance of these activities requires the candidate to have strong verbal and written communication skills, as well as the ability to supervise staff and interact with management. The position will report to the Accounting Director – Financial Reporting.
Job Requirements:
- Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or related field
- Bank regulatory financial reporting experience and/or knowledge
- Minimum of 5-7 years of progressive experience, CPA a plus
- Strong verbal and written communication skills
- Strong analytical skills
- Ability to meet deadlines
- Accounting, audit, risk, or compliance experience preferred
- Familiarity with financial reporting processes and controls
- Working knowledge of Excel and Word, with Lotus Notes, PowerPoint, and Access knowledge a plus

Department Description:
Huntington National Bank
41 S. High Street
Columbus, OH 43287
Brief Description: Fulltime; Salary Grade 73/74 (based on experience). The CMG CFO position will provide financial support and guidance to the Capital Markets Group (Currency Risk Mgmt./FX, Corporate Derivatives, and Institutional Sales & Trading), including the monthly financial processes (forecasting/pre-close analysis/standard reporting), annual budget process, analysis of potential new business sub-segments, products and/or services, and communication of the story (i.e., celebrate successes and identify opportunities for improvement).
Detailed Description:
· Acts as the primary financial support to the Executive Managing Director of the Capital Markets Group, as well as each of the Directors for Corporate Derivatives, Currency Risk Management (FX), and Institutional Sales & Trading (Brokerage).
· Partners closely with the Capital Markets Group as a 'Subject Matter Expert' (understands who the customers are, as well as their business needs, and provides strategic financial advice and guidance by effectively communicating insightful conclusions about historical trends and projecting/forecasting the future, while making recommendations that will exploit strengths, overcome weaknesses, and improve performance).
· Understands how external factors affect the Bank (i.e., anticipates how changes in the industry or economy will affect the business, realizes the impact of competitor and government actions, understands the expectations of shareholders, stock analysts, and rating agencies, and creates models and scenarios based on possible outcomes of these factors), and exercises professional skepticism and applies business and industry knowledge and other experiences to anticipate and respond to issues.
· Thinks like an entrepreneur (i.e., looks at the Bank's key financial and performance measures, and thinks about ways to make more money, grow market share, etc… driven by the desire to find opportunities and threats, and to locate innovative ways to answer key questions).
· Serves as a positive role model and acknowledges others efforts and accomplishments, encourages colleagues to draw on each other’s strengths and experience to work together effectively within and across teams, leads and/or trains less-experienced colleagues, serves as a resource to others for ideas on how to solve problems, shares insights by participating on cross-functional teams, and takes an active leadership role when appropriate, gaining the trust and confidence of others through his/her actions over time and maintaining and expanding a network of contacts.
· Takes initiative for continuous improvement by looking for ways to be more effective, pursue training to enhance abilities, and seek advice on how to improve existing processes, recommends changes in practice aimed at improving processes, and understands concept over process (i.e., understand what value a process adds to the Bank or how it fits in with other key processes, determine whether it makes sense, and identify unnecessary processes to eliminate).
Job Requirements:
· Demonstrated strong written and verbal communication skills as this position is highly visible and interfaces with many levels of management (i.e., communicate complex ideas clearly and concisely both verbally and in writing and demonstrate confidence and competence in group meeting situations).
· Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to provide advanced analysis of financial institution balance sheet, income statement, financial metrics and similar financial reports, understands the concept of materiality (i.e., knows when information is relevant), and possesses solid understanding of the Capital Markets Group's major revenue sources (products, customers), key computer systems, work flow processes, and geographic distribution as needed to prepare complex analyses of financial statements and reports.
· Ability to see the 'big picture' without getting lost in the detail (i.e., take a top-down approach to analysis and investigation, fully understanding the Bank's mission and objectives, to discover insights).
· Understand management accounting concepts, such as variance analyses & activity-based costing techniques, return on investment & break-even analyses, contribution margin & incremental costing analyses, and using statistics to locate patterns in data.
· Possess ability to educate and motivate (i.e., share financial knowledge and expertise by conducting formal training sessions, and take the necessary steps to boost morale, instill confidence and provide encouragement to help everyone win while presenting a professional image and leading by example).
· Ability to develop effective controls and processes to ensure risks are measured, monitored, and controlled and compliance requirements are adhered to on an on-going basis.
· Ability to navigate successfully through the Bank's financial systems and informal people networks to get data & info (i.e., know the limitations of the data they contain, and how to extract data from them, and know who to ask for help or answers utilizing people skills).
· Proactively manages issues and assignments. Moves work forward with limited direction; manages changing priorities with ease and remains poised and professional in facing resistance or challenges. Possesses a strong sense of what is important to Huntington.

Direct the Risk team's self-monitoring and testing activities to ensure that they are performed in accordance with Corporate Risk Management requirements. · Manage Retail and Business Banking Segment Policy & Governance function, including:
· ensure all testing is appropriately designed, certified and executed in partnership with the Business Units;
· develop Risk related policies and appropriate governance processes within the Segment;
· support all Corporate related Control functions - Compliance, Audit, Finance, etc. - within the Segment as it relates to Enterprise Risk.
· Manage and ensure the administration of operational and regulatory risk strategy programs for their business segment.
· Lead the team of Risk Specialists to evaluate the adequacy and effectiveness of enterprise and regulatory controls and the resulting risk and self assessments.
· Deliver timely escalation of all issues requiring attention to senior management.
· Work with the business segment to ensure the overall risk function is effectively supporting strategic goals.
· Collaborate with audit/business segment/corporate risk to address issues with plausible action plans and target dates.
· Monitor pertinent key risk indicators and investigate and report on adverse movements in risk within the segment.
· Must be aware of and keep abreast of credit risk associated with assigned business segment.
· Facilitate training for business segment, ensuring colleagues complete required training with the allotted timeframes.
· Serve as a liaison for internal and external exams when required.
· Ensure business segment adheres to corporate and business segment policies and procedures.

with expertise in retail banking.

risks and risk assessments.

· Manage Retail and Business Banking Segment risk related efforts, across business units, to assist in driving to a better control environment, including:
· drive to a better operations data environment in monitoring exceptions and improved MIS;
· represent Risk on cross business teams designed to improve risk mitigation and controls;
· participate in large project related efforts to ensure Risk input is properly assessed;
· support cross business unit and Segment risk related projects.
· Deliver timely escalation of all issues requiring attention to senior management.
· Work with the business segment to ensure the overall risk function is effectively supporting strategic goals.
· Collaborate with audit/business segment/corporate risk to address issues with plausible action plans and target dates.
· Monitor pertinent key risk indicators and investigate and report on adverse movements in risk within the segment.
· Must be aware of and keep abreast of credit risk associated with assigned business segment.
· Facilitate training for business segment, ensuring colleagues complete required training with the allotted time frames.
· Serve as a liaison for internal and external exams when required.
· Ensure business segment adheres to corporate and business segment policies and procedures.
Job Requirements:
· Master's Degree preferred, Bachelor's Degree required.
· 10 years of progressively responsible risk, compliance, business or operational experience with expertise in retail banking.
· In depth knowledge of risk management principles, including experience analyzing operational risks and risk assessments.
· Excellent analytical, problem-solving, interpersonal and communication skills (both oral and written).
· Excellent influencing, consulting, organizational and leadership skills.
· Ability to multi-task and work in a fast paced environment.
· Team player.

41 S. High Street
Columbus, OH 43287
-or-
917 Euclid Avenue

Brief Description: Fulltime; Salary Grade 72. The Treasury Management (TM) Senior Financial Analyst position will provide business and financial support for the TM team. The role will assist the TM Chief Financial Officer (CFO) with strategic and tactical analyses required to consult with the TM executive management team in order to grow the business. Additional responsibilities include assisting the CFO with monthly financial processes (forecasting/pre-close analysis/standard reporting), and the annual budget process.
Detailed Description:
· Partner closely with the Treasury Management team as a “Subject Matter Expert” (understands who the customers are, as well as their business needs, and provides strategic financial advice and guidance by communicating insight into historical trends and projecting/forecasting the future, while making recommendations that will exploit strengths, overcome weaknesses, and improve performance).
· Work with the TM CFO to create financial statements for the TM team. Create the detailed story behind the financials and adjust reporting to meet the needs of Executive, TM and non-TM audiences.
· Manages all aspects of Treasury Management P&L and Balance Sheet. Understands components of TM revenue, including relationship between interest and non-interest components. Develop an understanding of TM operating expenses (including vendor activity) and assist in the development of strategies and tactics to manage cost.
· Partner with the TM sales team, performing analyses of sales results and activity. Work closely with the TM CFO to analyze the impact of sales activity on incentive compensation plans and the realization of revenue from closed sales.
· Participate in the creation and review of business cases supporting TM strategies. Engage with TM colleagues, including TM Product Management, to develop a deep understanding of the business case and influences factors that drive value.
· Serve as a positive role model and acknowledges others efforts and accomplishments, encouraging colleagues to draw on each other’s strengths and experience to work together effectively within and across teams, leads and/or trains less-experienced colleagues, serves as a resource to others for ideas on how to solve problems, shares insights by participating on cross-functional teams, and takes an active leadership role when appropriate, gaining the trust and confidence of others through his/her actions over time and maintaining and expanding a network of contacts.
· Take initiative for continuous improvement by looking for ways to be more effective, pursue training to enhance abilities, and seek advice on how to improve existing processes, recommends changes in practice aimed at improving processes, and understands concept over process (i.e., understand what value a process adds to the Bank or how it fits in with other key processes, determine whether it makes sense, and identify unnecessary processes to eliminate).
· Exercise professional skepticism and apply business and industry knowledge and other experiences to anticipate and respond to issues.
Job Requirements:
· Demonstrate strong written and verbal communication skills as this position is highly visible and interfaces with many levels of management (i.e., communicate complex ideas clearly and concisely both verbally and in writing and demonstrate confidence and competence in group meeting situations).
· Possess strong analytical and critical thinking skills, providing advanced analysis of financial institution balance sheet, income statement, financial metrics and similar financial reports. Practices the concept of materiality (i.e., knows when information is relevant), and possesses solid understanding of the Bank's major revenue sources (products, customers), key computer systems, work flow processes, and geographic distribution as needed to prepare complex analyses of financial statements and reports.
· Create a 'big picture' view without getting lost in the detail (i.e., take a top-down approach to analysis and investigation, fully understanding the Bank's mission and objectives, to discover insights).
· Understand management accounting concepts, such as variance analyses & activity-based costing techniques, return on investment & break-even analyses, contribution margin & incremental costing analyses, and using statistics to locate patterns in data.
· Develop effective controls and processes to ensure risks are measured, monitored, and controlled and compliance requirements are adhered to on an on-going basis.
· Navigate successfully through the Bank's financial systems and informal people networks to get data & info (i.e., know the limitations of the data they contain, and how to extract data from them, and know who to ask for help or answers utilizing people skills).
· Proactively manages issues and assignments. Moves work forward with limited direction; manages changing priorities with ease and remains poised and professional in facing resistance or challenges. Possesses a strong sense of what is important to Huntington.
· Proficiently uses Microsoft Office tools, and know when to use the various features of these tools, to analyze information and turn data into conclusions (i.e., pull together disparate data, solve problems, and present information to management in a format suitable to their needs and personal style).
· Degree Required: MS/MA in Business, Finance, Economics or Accounting.
· Minimum of 5 years experience in the financial services industry required.
Additional Details:
Grade 72
EOE/M/F/D/V
Huntington does not accept solicitation from any Third Party Recruiter for any position.

Store Banking Specialist - provides financial solutions using proactive, consultative sales skills to market bank products and services
Hours: Mon-Fri 8:00am-8:00pm Sat 8:00am-5:00pm Sun 10:00am-4:00pm
Detailed Description:
If you are an over achieving, high energy, passionate and ambitious sales person, Huntington is where you want to be! We are embarking on a new endeavor and are in need of expanding our sales team to deliver financial services that will enhance the lives of our customers, prospects and communities. In return for you hard work and success, we offer benefits you truly deserve: a lucrative incentive plan, the full spectrum of benefits and paid time off. We strongly encourage community involvement and participation in group events. If this describes you and meets your needs, “WELCOME TO HUNTINGTON!”
In this role,
· You will have the opportunity to change the lives of your customers, prospects, businesses and communities each day, by providing financial solutions using your proactive, consultative sales skills to market bank products and services in a branch location.
· You will surpass sales goals by uncovering and meeting the financial needs of customers, prospects, and businesses.
· Each day, you will have the opportunity to build relationships and do your best work, as you open new accounts, generate loans, sell and refer specialty products and resolve customer inquiries with a high performing team.

· Minimum 1 year of successful and proven retail sales experience in a highly competitive incentive-driven environment

· Ability to work a flexible full-time schedule during the following hours: 8:00am-8:00pm Mon-Fri, 8:00am-5:00pm Sat, and 10:00am-4:00pm Sun
Other Traits, Characteristics and Experience

· Series 6 and state Insurance licenses preferred
· Superior communication skills

The Branch Manager provides 'Simply the Best' customer service and leadership at all times.
• Creates and executes goals for solidifying and gaining new consumer and business customer relationships.

• Complies with Bank security practices.

Easton Business Service Center
Columbus, OH 43219
Brief Description: Business Systems Analyst Senior – Responsible for delivering first-class production support within the Oracle ebusiness Suite of tools that meets the needs of external and internal customers.
Detailed Description:
Seeking a candidate with a passionate focus on team partnership to provide optimal services and solutions based upon business requirements. This position requires a highly motivated, team oriented individual with strong accountability and customer service skills to embrace our corporate vision and values. Provides production support for the Oracle eBusiness Suite HR/Payroll/Financials System (Essential Connections) and other systems as assigned. · Oracle system administration responsibilities include, but are not limited to, issue troubleshooting and resolution, end user security administration, scheduled job administration, and monitoring of system error messages.
· Work with business and technical team to develop all required documentation in accordance with Oracle AIM methodology and Huntington's Change Control and SDLC processes and procedures.
· Initial analysis, distribution, and monitoring of the internal support system (BVS) tickets submitted to the Oracle applications technical team.

· Must have at least 5 years of progressively responsible experience as a Business Systems Analyst or similar professional position.
· Experience supporting Oracle e-Business Suite including HRMS, Payroll, Advanced Benefits, Accounts Payable, Purchasing, iRecruitment, iProcurement (5 years preferred).
· Ability to work effectively in a team environment and possesses a strong commitment to the team and customer.
· Experience coordinating project activities and developing project management deliverables.
· Self-motivated and assertive while possessing the ability to manage multiple priorities in a team environment.
· Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
· Extremely well organized and detail oriented.
· Experience with UNIX, Windows Admin, 24x7 scheduler, ColdFusion, Toad or SQL Developer a plus.
· Understanding of banking industry a plus.

Position can be based in Cleveland, OH or Pittsburgh, PA
Brief Description: The ABL Senior Underwriter independently evaluates new deals to determine viability of the credit and makes appropriate recommendations to management. The credit evaluation will entail independent analysis of financial data, industry knowledge and existing economic conditions to form a conclusion as to an entity’s financial condition and ascertain what risks a given loan structure presents.
Detailed Description:
• Evaluates new deals to determine viability of the credit and makes appropriate recommendations to management.
• Credit evaluation will entail independent analysis of financial data, industry knowledge and existing economic conditions to form a conclusion as to an entity’s financial condition and ascertain what risks a given loan structure presents.
• Expected to handle larger, more complex deals and work with less direction from the Underwriting Manager.
• Time management is essential as deadlines are critical.
• Facilitate the preparation of the credit approval sheets with the ability to manage more than one presentation simultaneously with other activities.
• Meet with the Business Development Officer and or Regional Manager to gain a clear understanding of the prospect’s loan requests, terms and conditions agreed upon in the proposal letter and a description of the collateral categories to secure the loan. Coordinate with the Underwriting Manager and other team members and discuss the key credit issues and due diligence scope.
• Visit the prospect during the underwriting process in order to 1)conduct interviews with key management; 2) analyze historical financial statements and business trends; 3) analyze operating cash flow and future debt service requirements; 4) analyze and verify the reasonableness of the assumptions made in the prospect’s business plans and projections and 5) analyze and incorporate the collateral exam results.
• Other activities include: Identifying relevant credit strengths and weaknesses and mitigating such risks; Prepare cash flow projections using the Huntington ABL model and sensitize for variables; Access the overall collateral position in relation to the proposed structure; Evaluate key management; Access the business and industry trends and impact on prospect’s business; Determine validity and adequacy of key financial covenants
• Interpersonal skills are required, as the underwriter will be interacting with both internal and external Bank contacts (i.e. prospects, clients, auditors, intermediaries, etc.).
• The underwriter will need to be able to present the facts in a reader friendly format by providing information in a concise and logical manner allowing the reader to grasp the issues and strengths quickly.
Job Requirements:
Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree
• 4-5 years experience as an underwriter required.
Other Requirements:
• Proven written and verbal communication skills
• Ability to meet time lines
• Excellent analytical skills and working knowledge of Asset Based Lending process and procedures.
Additional Details:
Grade 73
EOE M/F/D/V
Huntington does not accept solicitations from third party recruiters for any position.

Department Description:
Huntington National Bank
17 S. High Street
Columbus, OH 43215
Brief Description:
The Compliance Section Manager (CSM) oversees all ongoing activities related to the development, implementation, review, maintenance of, and adherence to, the compliance policies and procedures of assigned business segments. The CSM is responsible for identifying, advising and monitoring for compliance issues, concerns, and deficiencies with applicable laws, rules and regulations. This position reports to the Trust/Fiduciary Compliance Group Manager (CGM).
Responsibilities of the Fiduciary/Investment CSM span the scope of these business segments.
This position will also be responsible for performing other duties and projects as assigned by the Trust/Fiduciary CGM.
Detailed Description:
Duties for this position include completing and distributing periodic risk assessments; monitoring for compliance with laws, rules and regulations; development of control testing; serving as a liaison to external and internal auditors; serving as an advisor to business segments regarding regulatory issues; and communicating the following to business segments and senior and executive management: regulatory issuances, changes and guidance, policy exceptions, and compliance issues.
This position supports Huntington’s fiduciary and investment business which consists of 4 business segments: Huntington Asset Services, Mezzanine, FX and Derivatives.
Job Requirements:
Requirements:
· Bachelor’s Degree
· one or more of JD, CPA, CRCM, Series 7, Series 24
In addition to a BS or BA in a related field, this position requires highly technical knowledge of banking, securities and investment related laws, rules and regulations, and could to be filled with a candidate licensed with a J.D.
Areas of experience/responsibility: two or more of registered investment advisory, brokerage, asset servicing, insurance, derivatives, mezzanine financing, foreign exchange.
Additional Details:
Grade 73
EOE/M/F/D/V

Department Description: Treasury Management Sales Advisor, Cleveland, OH
Brief Description: Responsible for identifying Treasury Management opportunities with prospects and clients.
Detailed Description:
• Through consultative, needs-based selling, the Treasury Management Sales Advisor is responsible for identifying Treasury Management sales opportunities with both prospects and clients.
• Position duties include independent Treasury Management sales prospecting, cross-selling to existing clients, product pricing and account structuring, proposal creation and presentation, and performing client reviews.
• Through a strong partnership with Relationship Bankers, the Sales Advisor carries out market, portfolio, and deposit strategies while identifying cross-sell opportunities for other lines of business.
• The Sales Advisor also must maintain strong industry knowledge, stay current on competitor offerings, and provide market and competitor feedback to ensure competitiveness.
• Cross sells other bank products, and stays current on competitor offerings to suggest product improvements.
• Develops and maintains profitable and quality cash management relationships with customers.
• May mentor other Treasury Management colleagues.
Job Requirements:
Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
• Qualified candidate must have a minimum of 2 years of Treasury Management Sales experience or a minimum of 7 years of outside relationship sales experience is required.
Other Requirements:
• Advanced sales, negotiation, and communication skills required.
• Knowledge of bank products and continual development of product expertise is a must.
• CTP designation is strongly preferred.
• MBA is a plus
• Ability to develop working relationships with individuals at all levels of an organization.
• Excellent communication skills both verbal and written.
• Excellent organizational skills.
• Knowledge of Microsoft Office required.
• Lotus Notes experience preferred.

Department Description:
IT-Huntington Service Desk
Easton Business Service Center
Columbus, OH 43219
Brief Description:
Service Desk Analyst, part-time, provides expert technical frontline support to diagnose, analyze, research, and resolve computer problems for internal and external Enterprise customers. 
Work Hours: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Friday 8:30am-1:30pm and Saturday 12-5pm (P2)
Detailed Description:
Requires passionate focus on customer service, team interaction, and computing infrastructure support services to provide optimal IT solutions based on business requirements. Need a highly motivated, teamwork and communication oriented individual with strong accountability to embrace our corporate vision and values, and reflect our associate guidelines of “Simply the Best” service.
As an Essential Partner, responsibilities include:
• Provide expert technical frontline support to diagnose, analyze, research, and resolve computer problems for internal and external Enterprise customers.
• Respond to the technical needs and questions of customers concerning their applications, equipment, and access.
• Provide the initial contact for non-primary hours of support.
• Communicate outage notification for major system outages to customers and management.
• Generate technical documentation in areas of technical specialization and expertise.
• Adhere to policies and procedures.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
• Associate's degree in computer science, management information systems, or related field of study or a combination of technical education and job experience with microcomputers, network and/or mainframe technologies and applications.
• Minimum 1-3 years of experience in a customer service position related to technology support activities.
Other Traits and Characteristics
• Strong interpersonal, communication (both oral and written), and problem-solving skills.
Additional Details:
This position will require the qualified applicant to be available to work during the following off peak hours to provide back up support during PTO, unplanned/scheduled absences, etc as needed. Off Peak hours are as follows:
Sat 9 pm–Sun 8am
Sun 9 pm–Mon 6am
Mon 4 pm–Mon 9pm
Grade 70
EOE M/F/D/V

Department Description:
The Huntington National Bank
127 South Main Street
Butler, PA 16001
Brief Description: Branch Manager, Full-time, including Saturday availability. Oversees day-to-day sales, operations & leadership within a specific branch. Builds and expands quality consumer & corporate customer relationships.
Detailed Description:
The Branch Manager provides 'Simply the Best' customer service and leadership at all times.
• Creates and executes goals for solidifying and gaining new consumer and business customer relationships.
• Conducts teleconsulting for the benefit of customers; cross-sells products; makes outside sales calls to solicit business.
• Sets clear expectations that lead to sales success for direct reports; drives, supports and achieves monthly sales quotas.
• Effectively resolves issues with clients/customers and associates.
• Establishes business contacts and networks through community relations activities.
• Sets clear expectations and measurable outcomes, while coaching and developing direct reports.
• Drives accountability and builds trust through character, connection, and competence.
• Demonstrates the ability to assess direct reports performance and behaviors effectively.
• Provides coaching, disciplinary actions and exits non-performers while adhering to company policies.
• Successfully recruits and hires the appropriate staff to deliver on expectations.
• Drives and coaches the customer service process and model of “Simply the Best” service.
• Understands the general principles of business and ensures operational efficiency as it relates to policies, procedures, compliance, loan accuracy, corporate audits, fee refunds, work schedules, forecasting, accuracy, and efficient operation.
• Complies with Bank security practices.
• Maintains customer confidentiality at all times.
Action Oriented – Is full of energy for the things he/she sees as interesting and challenging.
Building Effective Teams – Creates strong morale and spirit in his/her team.
Business Acumen - Understands how business works holistically.
Customer Focus - Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers.
Developing Direct Reports - Provides challenging and stretching tasks and assignments.
Directing Others - Is good at establishing clear direction.
Drive for Results - Can be counted on to successfully exceed goals.
Ethics and Values - Adheres to an appropriate and effective set of core values and beliefs during both favorable and challenging situations.
Integrity and Trust - Is seen as a direct and truthful individual.
Priority Setting - Spends his/her time and the time of others on the most critical needs of the business.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
• 3 years of Retail Banking sales experience with heavy emphasis on consumer and business development required
• Bachelor's degree in business-related major or equivalent of 2 years of successful sales management experience, preferably in financial services
• Must have excellent written and verbal (face-to-face and phone) communication skills including professional grammar and demeanor
• Intermediate PC proficiency
Other Traits, Characteristics and Experience
• Experience managing both a sales and operations team
• Demonstrated ability to coach and develop individuals and the team to high achievement in both sales and service
• Prefer proven success in meeting established sales and referral goals for banking products and services to include investment and insurance products
• Series 6 Securities license and Insurance License in good standing a plus
• Banking experience and community involvement in the local market helpful
• Strong organizational skills with attention to detail
• Ability to multi-task

Grade 71

Department Description:
The Huntington National Bank
7 Easton Oval
Columbus, OH 43219
Brief Description: The position will report directly to the Chief Auditor of the Corporation and also includes management of 5-7 IT auditors. The ideal candidate is a proven IT audit manager with an exceptional delivery track record within a demanding environment.
Detailed Description:
The candidate should possess a detailed working knowledge of methodologies and techniques for performing IT audit engagements, including IT infrastructure and business applications. The candidate should also possess a general knowledge of financial services industry software applications, system conversion, M&A systems integration, and development/application of Computer Assisted Audit Techniques (CAATs). Additionally, the candidate must be able to develop and maintain working relationships with IT and bank management, as well as the broader audit team in order to effectively and efficiently execute audit responsibilities.
· Managing IA’s execution of IT audit engagements
· Providing technical IT audit guidance for integrated audit engagements
· Identification and communication of emerging issues related to deployment and management of information technology, specifically within the banking industry
· Developing audit objectives and related audit procedures to address relevant IT risks
· Planning, execution, and oversight of software application control design and operating effectiveness and IT general controls testing, and evaluating audit results to determine if issues exist and improvement recommendations are necessary.
· Managing and developing multiple internal audit colleagues
· Strong verbal and written communication skills, as well as the ability to manage multiple audit engagements simultaneously
· Monitoring of annual audit plan progress and changes, engagement budgets/staffing and audit recommendation status and follow-up related to areas of responsibilities
Job Requirements:
Qualifications:
To succeed in this demanding role, the candidate ideally possesses a strong combination of the following experiences and capabilities:
· 10+ years of progressively responsible experience in IT audit (either public accounting or internal audit) or IT management, including management
· Strong working knowledge of information technology risk management and control frameworks (COBIT, ITIL)
· Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Business, or a related field
Other Requirements:
· Working knowledge of MS Access, Excel and Word; Lotus Notes; and audit software applications
· CPA, CISA, CIA or demonstrated progress toward certification
· Leadership
· Technical accounting knowledge
· Project management
· Conflict management
Additional Details:
Grade 74
EOE/M/F/D/V
Huntington does not accept solicitation from any Third Party Recruiter for any position.

Brief Description:
Internal Audit is seeking a highly motivated individual for an IT Staff Auditor Sr. position. 
The IT Staff Auditor Sr. will be exposed to various businesses and functions within the organization and assist with the planning, testing and reporting of both IT integrated audits and IT general control engagements. Audits will be performed in accordance with department and professional standards. The IT Staff Auditor Sr. will interact with various operational, compliance, financial and IT Auditors while performing their responsibilities.

Performance of audit procedures and documentation of results requires the IT Staff Auditor Sr. candidate to have strong verbal and written communication skills.

· 3-5 years experience in IT Audit, financial services experience preferred
· Strong verbal and written communication skills
· Comfortable working in a team environment
· Ability to meet deadlines
· Experience with IT application controls testing
· Professional certification (CISA, CIA, etc.) or progress toward certification preferred
· Knowledge of financial services industry IT applications a plus

This Credit Analyst position provides 'Simply the Best' customer service at all times.

• Prepare a written evaluation of borrowers’ financial condition and future outlook.

This position generally leads to a career in commercial lending either as a portfolio manager or sales executive and will include sales in either position.
