Department Description:
Huntington National Bank
2361 Morse Road
Columbus, OH 43229
Brief Description: Serves as the first point of contact to handle and process requests from current and past colleagues, managers, HR Business Partners and external customers regarding questions that are related to payroll, time keeping, benefits, compensation, position management and other related areas including but not limited to policy, plan descriptions, processes and HR transactional activity.
Detailed Description:
The HRSC Liaison focuses on responding to inquiries via phone or email on a variety of issues regarding company policy and procedure, employee benefits, payroll, and other programs as well as educate on the use of employee websites and Human Resource applications. Responsible for all Human Resource data entry including new hires, terminations, transfers, wages, performance evaluations, address changes, name changes, etc. Independently applies concepts of processes, policy, procedures, plan documents, workflows, and practices required to effectively provide council and resolution to specific questions in a timely and accurate manner. Position requires research, analyzing and resolving issues utilizing Oracle and internal reference materials. Tracks all inquiries, escalates to other areas within HR when appropriate, and sees through to resolution. Maintains accurate documentation of all questions/concerns from current and past colleagues, managers, HR Business Partners and external customers via Colleague Call Log for thorough metric reporting. Collaborates with appropriate HR partners to ensure all policies and procedures are kept up to date and provides input for ideas and suggestions to improve workflow processes. Promotes the use of on-line tools and assists with accessing and using these systems to foster a self-service environment. Must understand and support a centralized human resource model.
Position may work on special projects as assigned.
Job Requirements:
EDUCATION/COURSE OF STUDY:
HR Diploma. Associates degree or higher preferred in Human Resources/Business or equivalent work experience.
WORK EXPERIENCE:
This position requires a minimum of 1-2 years of HR or related customer service experience.
OTHER: 
Demonstrated customer service orientation with excellent interpersonal skills including tact and diplomacy, good verbal and written communication skills, results driven mentality, proven organizational skills, able to adapt to different communication styles, ability to resolve conflict, analytical, and prioritization skills. Proficient in the following personal computer applications: Word, Excel and Access applications; email, etc. Oracle system preferred.

Grade: 69
EOE/M/F/D/V

Department Description: Process Administrator in Investor Reporting at 7575 Huntington Park Drive
Brief Description: Process Administrator 40 hours Monday – Friday. Candidate is primarily responsible, but not limited to daily and monthly Investor Reporting, Remitting and Reconciling functions, Investor/Custodial Accounting daily and monthly functions and/or Special Loans daily and monthly functions. For all functional areas, adherence to department policies, procedures and service levels as well as investor and/or regulatory/compliance requirements is a must.
Detailed Description:
• Provides monthly loan performance reporting via investor required formats. The successful candidate will possess an experienced financial background relative to mortgage banking and financial research and analysis. The position requires the ability to maintain appropriate documentation of any ongoing research as well as documentation supporting all regular monthly activities.
• Facilitate the accurate and timely remitting of monthly actual collections and scheduled remittances. The successful candidate will utilize system and ad hoc reports to calculate and process timely and accurate remittances. The financial transactions resulting from any Sales, Acquisitions and/or Service Release activities must also be timely and accurate.
• Requires the ability to maintain appropriate documentation of any ongoing research as well as documentation supporting all regular monthly reporting activities. A monthly resolution of discrepancies between the expected, reported and actual activity in accordance with internal department deadlines and investor expectations is also required.
• Utilize the MSP system, other internal systems and ad hoc reports to prepare a comprehensive daily, weekly and/or monthly reconciliation of our custodial bank accounts as well as our internal servicing related accounts. Research on and response to requests for check stop payments, check research and reissuing checks. Adhere to bank policies and procedures and comply with legal, regulatory and investor defined reconciling requirements. Required reconciliation preparation and documentation must comply with Huntington internal, external and Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) Audit standards.
• Custodial Account Reconciliations - FNMA MBS, GNMA MBS, FHLMC 3-part reconciliations, Private Investor Reconciliations (S/S, S/A and A/A), Investor T/I Reconciliations.
• Clearing Account Reconciliations - Payment Clearing Accounts, Escrow Clearing Account, Payoff Clearing Account, NSF Account, Investor Disbursement Account, Loan Sales Account.
• Completes processing of ARM updates, ARM audits, partial releases, balloon resets, loan modifications and SCRA updates. Keen research and above average analytical abilities assist with researching and resolving complex issues. Flexible to frequently changing processes or procedure updates as published and verbally communicated by management. Strong attention to detail and accuracy of system updates a must. Adhere to written HNB policies and procedures, department policies and procedures as well as investor policies and procedures. All activities must comply with investor requirements as well as ensure adherence to HNB’s internal controls, internal audit, compliance and external audit standards. Ability to work within teams as well as interact with HNB colleagues outside of the department.
• Potential candidates must possess an ability to prioritize their daily workload with minimal supervision in accordance with established department and investor deadlines. The candidate must also be skilled in facilitating amicable interdepartmental resolutions.
• Must adhere to bank policies and procedures and comply with legal, regulatory and investor defined reporting, remitting and reconciling requirements.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
• High school diploma or equivalent.
• 2+ years of mortgage banking and/or investor accounting or, reporting or, reconciliations and overall cash flow experience required
Other Traits, Characteristics and Experience:
• Bachelor’s degree preferred.
• Ability to meet internal department and investor defined monthly deadlines and multi-task.
• Comprehensive financial research and analysis skills.
• Knowledge of Fidelity MSP loan servicing system preferred.
• Strong proficiency in Excel, Access and Word.
• Strong organizational, time management and strong attention to detail is required.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills required.
Additional Details:
Grade 68
EOE/M/F/D/V
No relocation is available for this position.
Huntington does not accept solicitation from Third Party Recruiters for any position.

58 South Park Place
Painesville, OH 44077
Brief Description: Personal Banker, Full-Time, 40 hrs, Mon – Sat, Brookgate Branch. Sells/cross-sells Bank products & Service to customers. Develops customer relationships & provides excellent customer service.
Detailed Description:
The Personal Banker provides “Simply the Best” customer service to each customer every time, which includes being accurate, being available, making it easy for our customer and personalizing all customer interactions.
• Using consultative selling techniques, analyzes and provides solutions for clients' financial needs. Makes sales referrals to specialized areas of the Bank based on customer need.

The Sr. Financial Advisor position provides 'Simply the Best' customer service and leadership at all times.
The individual filling this dynamic position will:

Department Description: Manages and ensures the administration of operational and regulatory risk strategy programs for the Remote Banking (online, mobile, debit/ATM and related). Lead a team of Risk Specialists in driving risk mitigation strategies into the process while evaluating adequacy and effectiveness of enterprise and regulatory controls and the resulting risk and self assessments.
Brief Description: Responsible for driving risk mitigation strategies into the remote channel, including online, debit/ATM, mobile banking, and remote deposit capture and related activities.
Detailed Description:
· Drive risk mitigation strategies into the remote channel, including online, debit/ATM, mobile banking, and remote deposit capture and related activities.
· Manage and ensure the administration of operational and regulatory risk strategy programs for this business unit.
· Direct self-monitoring and testing activities to ensure that they are performed in accordance with Corporate Risk Management requirements.
· Lead the team of Risk Specialists to evaluate the adequacy and effectiveness of enterprise and regulatory controls and the resulting risk and self assessments.
· Deliver timely escalation of all issues requiring attention to senior management.
· Work with the business segment to ensure the overall risk function is effectively supporting strategic goals.
· Collaborate with audit/business segment/corporate risk to address issues with plausible action plans and target dates.
· Monitor pertinent key risk indicators and investigate and report on adverse movements in risk within the segment.
· Must be aware of and keep abreast of credit risk associated with assigned business segment.
· Facilitate training for business segment, ensuring colleagues complete required training with the allotted timeframes.
· Serve as a liaison for internal and external exams when required.
· Ensure business segment adheres to corporate and business segment policies and procedures.
Job Requirements:
· Bachelor's Degree required.
· 5 to 7 years of progressively responsible risk, compliance, business or operational experience with expertise in 'remote' retail banking -- online, debit card/ATM, mobile banking, remote deposit capture, telephone banking.
· In depth knowledge of risk related authentication practices and working knowledge of best practice risk management principles for remote banking.
· Excellent analytical, problem-solving, interpersonal and communication skills (both oral and written).
· Excellent influencing, consulting, organizational and leadership skills.
· Excellent understanding and working knowledge of industry trends, risk mitigation tools and practices.
· Ability to multi-task and work in a fast paced environment.
· Team player.
· Master's Degree preferred.
· 10 plus years of progressively responsible risk, compliance, business or operational experience with expertise in retail banking that includes sales, service, operations and incentives.

Department Description:

Westar Bldg
440 Polaris Parkway
Westerville, OH 43082
Brief Description: Insurance Account Relationship Manager. Full-time, Monday-Friday. They will assist the producer in the production of new and renewal accounts and act as producer on assigned house accounts.
Detailed Description:
1. Self Management and Development
a. Meets with Supervisor to agree upon goals and performance standards to ensure alignment and gain agreement
b. Presents updates to goals as indicated throughout year
c. Represents Huntington Insurance as product expert by staying current of changes, trends and opportunities within the industry
2. Follow Agency Procedures
a. Follow procedures as outlined in the Workflow and Procedure Manual
b. Utilize available automation and software applications following proper procedures including document management, Fax Advantage and the agency management system
c. Follow procedures as outlined in the Huntington Employee Handbook
d. Maintains strong knowledge of product line
e. Acts as a resource for review of suggestions for process improvement
3. Provide Customer Service to the Assigned Book of Business
a. Respond to customer inquiries within 1 business day
b. Takes ownership of customer (internal and external) questions and problems with resolution within 1 business day of receiving the data needed in order to make an informed response
c. Follow required service standards (appointments, service requirements, standards of excellence, strategizing / agendas, etc.)
d. Coordinate and communicate with the producer on open issues and account status
e. Provides input on problem resolution for less experienced staff members
4. Assist in the Coordination and Timely Delivery of Renewals
a. Oversee and direct the market survey process. This is done is conjunction with the producer if assigned
b. Delivery of renewal recommendations within established time frame
c. Obtain data required in order to finalize the renewal process
d. Prepares and submits quote requests and tracks timely receipt
e. Prepares proposal for delivery to client by Producer
f. Implement policy order once renewal order has been received from the client
g. Process policies in accordance with established procedures
h. Identify add on lines of business and implement where possible
i. Seek referrals and provide to other divisions
j. Assist the producer as requested with prospects
5. Maintain Client Data
a. Update policy information throughout the year per established standards
b. Maintain client contact data, carriers and other pertinent information within the agency management system
c. Enter activities per the established guidelines and provide timely follow up to open activities
d. Provides feedback on implementation and ongoing service to develop product line strategies
e. Utilize the document management system and naming conventions as defined within the workflow procedures
6. Assist in the Development of Staff
a. Serves as product line resource for less experienced staff
b. Assist Supervisor with training of new hires or less experienced staff
7. Corporate Initiative
a. Acts as the product line representative on 1 corporate project annually
b. Assists with the development and implementation of workflow changes required to support corporate initiatives
c. Other duties as assigned by management
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualificiations:
• Generally five or more years experience in Commercial Insurance as an Account Relationship Manager, Account Executive or related position required.
• P& C License required
Other Traits and Characteristics:
§ Group insurance preferred.
§ Excellent written and oral communication skills

Department Description:
Pittsburgh Commercial Banking
The TimesBuilding
336 Fourth Ave, Suite 2
Pittsburgh, PA15222
Brief Description: Create and execute effective marketing strategies leading to the acquisition and retention of targeted Huntington commercial banking prospects and clients within defined market territories. Develop and maintain profitable client relationships working with Portfolio Managers, Treasury Management Specialists, and various other Product Partners.
Detailed Description:
Business Development & Sales: With highest priority given to clients and prospects, relationship managers will proactively identify problems/solutions and deliver Simply the Best Service through disciplined strategies and processes.
¨ Establish and maintain prospect list for assigned territories. Creation and execution of weekly marketing letter campaign with goal of issuing and following up on 10-15 letters per week.
¨ Be capable of flexing to audience and clearly articulate HNB value proposition.
¨ Produce Weekly Goals for discussion and execution with Sales Team Leader. Submit results on Friday.
¨ Form and execute practical client entertainment strategies ensuring tangible return is generated from investment of time. Assist in the development and retention of existing clients through effective client relationship development plans.
¨ Coordinate and implement on boarding process with each new IHC.
¨ Obtain at least 2 referrals (with goal of 3) from existing clients during the year.
¨ Lead / prepare proposals, term sheets, and preview memos. Lead the presentation of all preview and approval meetings.
¨ Transfer call information and review CRISP Pipeline information to assure accuracy to/with Sales Associate on Weekly basis.
¨ Attend, be engaged, and execute action steps coming from Weekly Sales Meetings.
Product Knowledge: Have enough knowledge to be conversant about all the commercial products, ask basic questions, take initiative to learn, and pull in the proper resources when needed.
¨ Understands features and benefits of core commercial products
¨ Ability to convert benefits into solutions for the customer
¨ Understanding of essential partner product set
¨ Understands pricing, including cost/benefit analysis
¨ Ability to differentiate HNB’s products from competitors
Leadership and Partner Integration: Leadership is a skill that facilitates proactive decision making such that the account executive is motivated and disciplined to set challenging goals, while eager to improve those around them.
¨ Established personal goals to purposely stretch skills and abilities
¨ Ability to motivate and empower relationship team members
¨ Coach/Mentor other CBD members within and across teams to help them develop
¨ Ability to make timely decisions
¨ Delegates tasks to the appropriate team members
¨ Involvement with professional network to be visible to subordinates and management
¨ Active participation in HNB sponsored events
¨ Participation in community events, serving on local boards, demonstrating Huntington support for the local community.
Technology: Integration of current technologies is essential for relationship managers to readily track portfolios and deliver prompt responses to both customers and Essential Partners.
¨ Effective utilization of CRISP
¨ Effective utilization of Lotus Notes
¨ Effective utilization of Excel and Word applications
¨ Effective utilization of online industry tools
Living the Huntington Values: Represent, communicate, endorse, and behave according to Huntington’s Vision and Values in your daily activity. These include the following:
¨ Teamwork
¨ Communication
¨ Accountability
¨ Passion
¨ Diversity
¨ Service
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
· 3-5 years experience as a Commercial Relationship Manager or Sales Executive with proven sales experience in a calling environment
· Bachelor’s degree is required 
· Demonstrated consistent and effective negotiation skills
· Sound judgment in handling all aspects of customer relationships
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills, along with a high level of professionalism
· Demonstrated knowledge of credit structure, along with thorough understanding of current banking and capital markets
Additional Criteria:
· MBA is preferred
· Formal credit training is desirable
· Ability and desire to cross-sell other bank products
Additional Details:
Grade 73

Department Description:
The Huntington National Bank
1403 North Main Street
Findlay, OH 45840
Brief Description: Branch Manager, Full-time, including Saturday availability. Oversees day-to-day sales, operations & leadership within a specific branch. Builds and expands quality consumer & corporate customer relationships.
Detailed Description:
The Branch Manager provides 'Simply the Best' customer service and leadership at all times.
• Creates and executes goals for solidifying and gaining new consumer and business customer relationships.
• Conducts teleconsulting for the benefit of customers; cross-sells products; makes outside sales calls to solicit business.
• Sets clear expectations that lead to sales success for direct reports; drives, supports and achieves monthly sales quotas.
• Effectively resolves issues with clients/customers and associates.
• Establishes business contacts and networks through community relations activities.
• Sets clear expectations and measurable outcomes, while coaching and developing direct reports.
• Drives accountability and builds trust through character, connection, and competence.
• Demonstrates the ability to assess direct reports performance and behaviors effectively.
• Provides coaching, disciplinary actions and exits non-performers while adhering to company policies.
• Successfully recruits and hires the appropriate staff to deliver on expectations.
• Drives and coaches the customer service process and model of “Simply the Best” service.
• Understands the general principles of business and ensures operational efficiency as it relates to policies, procedures, compliance, loan accuracy, corporate audits, fee refunds, work schedules, forecasting, accuracy, and efficient operation.
• Complies with Bank security practices.
• Maintains customer confidentiality at all times.
Action Oriented – Is full of energy for the things he/she sees as interesting and challenging.
Building Effective Teams – Creates strong morale and spirit in his/her team.
Business Acumen - Understands how business works holistically.
Customer Focus - Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers.
Developing Direct Reports - Provides challenging and stretching tasks and assignments.
Directing Others - Is good at establishing clear direction.
Drive for Results - Can be counted on to successfully exceed goals.
Ethics and Values - Adheres to an appropriate and effective set of core values and beliefs during both favorable and challenging situations.
Integrity and Trust - Is seen as a direct and truthful individual.
Priority Setting - Spends his/her time and the time of others on the most critical needs of the business.

• 3 years of Retail Banking sales experience with heavy emphasis on consumer and business development required

We are embarking on a new endeavor and are in need of expanding our sales team to deliver financial services that will enhance the lives of our customers, prospects and communities. 41 S. High Street
Columbus, OH 43287
Brief Description: Full-time. Monday-Friday. This position will oversee and ensure the administration of operational and regulatory risk strategy programs for an identified, major business segment.
Detailed Description:
Responsibilities include:
• Direct self monitoring and testing. Evaluate effective of controls.
• Direct self-monitoring and testing activities to ensure that they are performed in accordance with Corporate Risk Management requirements.
• Evaluate the adequacy and effectiveness of enterprise and regulatory controls and the resulting risk and control self assessments.
• Deliver timely escalation of all issues requiring attention to senior management.
• Work with business segment management to ensure that the overall risk function is effectively supporting strategic goals.
• Collaborate with audit/business segment/corporate risk to address issues with plausible action plans and target dates.
• Act as a the central point for receipt and distribution of important risk information for the business segment and reciprocate the flow of information back to corporate risk management.
• Ensure business segment adheres to corporate and business unit policies and procedures. Must be aware of and keep abreast of credit risk associated with assigned business segment.
• Manages multiple Operational Risk Specialists. Note: Position level is to be used only in major business segment and must have multiple direct reports.
• Quality Assurance: Adheres to bank policies and procedures and complies with legal and regulatory requirements. Accountable for risk management, compliance and audit performance for area(s) of responsibility whether a supervisor, manager or individual contributor. Establishes or works with management to develop effective controls and processes to ensure risks are measured, monitored and controlled and compliance requirements are adhered to on an on-going basis. If applicable, ensures staff is properly trained, provided with appropriate resources and motivated to adhere to risk management principles. Maintains current knowledge of risk-related changes that may impact assigned area(s) of responsibility.
• Leadership: Coaches; counsels; develops work schedules; manages a function; responsible for hiring, terminations, salary adjustments and/or disciplinary actions; establishes/communicates group strategy.

• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
• 10 or more years experience in Investment Management, Audit or Risk related area

• Proactively seeks out current and potential clients for sales and customer service opportunities through calling activities and use of marketing resources.
• Works with banking office team members to achieve individual and banking office sales goals by opening new accounts, taking loan applications and closing loans
• Researches customer inquiries and provides resolutions within Bank guidelines.
• Responsible for maintaining up-to-date knowledge of products, services, technology, and regulations.
• Complies with internal security policies and procedures and maintains customer confidentiality at all times.
• Maintains records, reports, and procedures required by the office.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
• High school diploma or GED is required
• Minimum of 1-year of customer service and sales in banking, financial services or incentive driven retail sales required
Other Traits, Characteristics and Experience
• Must have excellent written and verbal (face-to-face and phone) communications skills, to include professional grammar and demeanor
• Experience working in a team environment and developing relationships
• PC and Internet proficiency
• Bachelor's degree in Business or a related field preferred
• Series 6 and state Insurance licenses preferred. Must obtain these licenses within a timeframe established by management
• Proven organizational skills with attention to detail
• The ability to multi-task

Department Description:
The Huntington National Bank
1403 North Main Street
Findlay, OH 45840
Brief Description: Branch Manager, Full-time, including Saturday availability. Oversees day-to-day sales, operations & leadership within a specific branch. Builds and expands quality consumer & corporate customer relationships.
Detailed Description:
The Branch Manager provides 'Simply the Best' customer service and leadership at all times.
• Creates and executes goals for solidifying and gaining new consumer and business customer relationships.
• Conducts teleconsulting for the benefit of customers; cross-sells products; makes outside sales calls to solicit business.
• Sets clear expectations that lead to sales success for direct reports; drives, supports and achieves monthly sales quotas.
• Effectively resolves issues with clients/customers and associates.
• Establishes business contacts and networks through community relations activities.
• Sets clear expectations and measurable outcomes, while coaching and developing direct reports.
• Drives accountability and builds trust through character, connection, and competence.
• Demonstrates the ability to assess direct reports performance and behaviors effectively.
• Provides coaching, disciplinary actions and exits non-performers while adhering to company policies.
• Successfully recruits and hires the appropriate staff to deliver on expectations.
• Drives and coaches the customer service process and model of “Simply the Best” service.
• Understands the general principles of business and ensures operational efficiency as it relates to policies, procedures, compliance, loan accuracy, corporate audits, fee refunds, work schedules, forecasting, accuracy, and efficient operation.
• Complies with Bank security practices.
• Maintains customer confidentiality at all times.
Action Oriented – Is full of energy for the things he/she sees as interesting and challenging.
Building Effective Teams – Creates strong morale and spirit in his/her team.
Business Acumen - Understands how business works holistically.
Customer Focus - Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers.
Developing Direct Reports - Provides challenging and stretching tasks and assignments.
Directing Others - Is good at establishing clear direction.
Drive for Results - Can be counted on to successfully exceed goals.
Ethics and Values - Adheres to an appropriate and effective set of core values and beliefs during both favorable and challenging situations.
Integrity and Trust - Is seen as a direct and truthful individual.
Priority Setting - Spends his/her time and the time of others on the most critical needs of the business.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
• 3 years of Retail Banking sales experience with heavy emphasis on consumer and business development required
• Bachelor's degree in business-related major or equivalent of 2 years of successful sales management experience, preferably in financial services
• Must have excellent written and verbal (face-to-face and phone) communication skills including professional grammar and demeanor
• Intermediate PC proficiency
Other Traits, Characteristics and Experience
• Experience managing both a sales and operations team
• Demonstrated ability to coach and develop individuals and the team to high achievement in both sales and service
• Prefer proven success in meeting established sales and referral goals for banking products and services to include investment and insurance products
• Series 6 Securities license and Insurance License in good standing a plus
• Banking experience and community involvement in the local market helpful
• Strong organizational skills with attention to detail
• Ability to multi-task
Additional Details:
Grade 71
EOE/M/F/D/V
Huntington does not accept solicitation from Third Party Recruiters for any position.

Department Description:
Huntington Corporate Offices
41 South High Street
Columbus, OH 43287
Brief Description: Provides leadership in developing the analytical capability to evaluate strategic opportunities within Huntington's geographic presence making recommendations based on strategic market analysis. Develops and builds business cases applying a strategic business perspective transforming data into creative and meaningful insights, predictions and recommendations with the ability to create and present professional presentations to Huntington's leadership communicating that analysis.
Detailed Description:
Provides leadership in developing the analytical capability to evaluate strategic opportunities within Huntington's geographic presence making recommendations based on strategic market analysis. Develops and builds business cases applying a strategic business perspective transforming data into creative and meaningful insights, predictions and recommendations with the ability to create and present professional presentations to Huntington's leadership communicating that analysis.
• Conduct in-depth cost and revenue analyses for strategic opportunities to determine overall profitability.
• Provide recommendations to senior management on a daily basis outlining the risks and benefits of various pricing programs for a given opportunity.
• Perform risk analytics to drive pricing strategies. Work with Sales and Sales Management to define long and short- term customer specific strategies.
• Pro-actively identify opportunities to improve profit and increase volumes.
• Support all Corporate initiatives to insure pricing and pricing processes are effectively incorporated..
• Provide detailed analysis of competitive markets and trends to senior management with actionable recommendations to effectively position Huntington in the market.
• Develop and maintain a wide variety of in-house analytical tools used in profitability and sensitivity analyses.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree
5-7 years related experience
OTHER TRAITS AND CHARACTERISTICS
• Demonstrated experience in leading strategic projects
• Strong organizational skills including demonstrated ability to handle multiple deadlines
• Proven success in leading teams including attracting, developing and retention
• Strong presentation and negotiating/influencing skills
Additional Details:
Exempt, Salary Grade 74
EOE M/F/D/V
Huntington does not accept solicitation from third party vendors for any positions

Department Description: In-store Branches South Euclid Area
Brief Description:
Store Banking Manager- Provides leadership and coaching within the branch.
Hours: Mon-Fri 8:00am-8:00pm Sat 8:00am-5:00pm Sun 10:00am-4:00pm
Detailed Description:
If you are an over achieving, high energy, passionate and ambitious sales leader, Huntington is where you want to be! We are embarking on a new endeavor and are in need of expanding our sales team to deliver financial services that will enhance the lives of our customers, prospects and communities. This position requires outstanding sales managers to lead, motivate and individually produce exemplary results. In return for you hard work and success, we offer benefits you truly deserve: a lucrative incentive plan, a full spectrum of benefits and paid time off. We strongly encourage community involvement and participation in group events. If this describes you and meets your needs, “WELCOME TO HUNTINGTON!”
In this role,
· You will have the opportunity to change the lives of your customers, prospects, businesses and communities each day by providing financial solutions using your proactive, consultative sales skills in a branch location with a high performing team that you will manage and lead.
· You and your team will surpass sales goals by uncovering and meeting the financial needs of customers, prospects, and businesses setting expectations and your leadership of the team.
· You will enjoy establishing relationships with host store management that will partner in facilitating customer connections.
· Each day, you will have the opportunity to do your best work as you and your team open new accounts, generate loans, sell and refer specialty products and resolve customer inquiries.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in business-related field; or equivalent experience of 5 years of successful retail sales in goaled or incentive-driven environment and 1 year managing a sales team.
• Minimum 3 years of successful retail sales and service experience in a goaled or incentive-driven environment required.
• Minimum 1 year experience managing or coaching a sales team to exceed sales goals.
• Minimum 6 months cash-handling experience required
Other Traits, Characteristics and Experience
· Superior communication skills
· Above average skills in mentoring and coaching a sales team
· Professional demeanor
· Strong organizational skills with attention to detail
· PC and internet proficiency
· Series 6 and state insurance licenses are strongly preferred
Additional Details:
Grade 72
EOE/M/F/D/V
Huntington does not accept solicitation from Third Party Recruiters for any position.

Brief Description: Mortgage Loan Officer - Full-time, 40 hrs, Mon – Fri, University/South Campus Gateway branches, Columbus, Ohio. Using internal and external referral sources, develops mortgage loan business; builds and maintains business relationships within the community.

The Mortgage Loan Officer position provides “Simply the Best” customer service to each customer service at all times. The associate in this position:

• Effective written and verbal communication skills

Department Description:
Huntington - Private Financial Group
Pittsburgh, PA
Brief Description: Private Financial Group - Loan Portfolio Manager, Sr. - Underwrites and manages a regional Private Banking commercial loan portfolio
Detailed Description:
Responsibilities:
• Approval of Private Banking commercial loans in accordance with PFG Private Banking Commercial Loan Policy
• Overrule approval of Private Banking Consumer loans
• Approval of PFG Portfolio Mortgage Loans

• Well organized with attention to detail

If you are an over achieving, high energy, passionate and ambitious sales person, Huntington is where you want to be! We are embarking on a new endeavor and are in need of expanding our sales team to deliver financial services that will enhance the lives of our customers, prospects and communities. In return for you hard work and success, we offer benefits you truly deserve: a lucrative incentive plan, the full spectrum of benefits and paid time off. · Minimum 1 year of successful and proven retail sales experience in a highly competitive incentive-driven environment

Department Description:
The Huntington National Bank
141 North Main Street
North Baltimore, OH 45872
Brief Description: Branch Manager, Full-time, including Saturday availability. Oversees day-to-day sales, operations & leadership within a specific branch. Builds and expands quality consumer & corporate customer relationships.
Detailed Description:
The Branch Manager provides 'Simply the Best' customer service and leadership at all times.
• Creates and executes goals for solidifying and gaining new consumer and business customer relationships.
• Conducts teleconsulting for the benefit of customers; cross-sells products; makes outside sales calls to solicit business.
• Sets clear expectations that lead to sales success for direct reports; drives, supports and achieves monthly sales quotas.
• Effectively resolves issues with clients/customers and associates.
• Establishes business contacts and networks through community relations activities.
• Sets clear expectations and measurable outcomes, while coaching and developing direct reports.
• Drives accountability and builds trust through character, connection, and competence.
• Demonstrates the ability to assess direct reports performance and behaviors effectively.
• Provides coaching, disciplinary actions and exits non-performers while adhering to company policies.
• Successfully recruits and hires the appropriate staff to deliver on expectations.
• Drives and coaches the customer service process and model of “Simply the Best” service.
• Understands the general principles of business and ensures operational efficiency as it relates to policies, procedures, compliance, loan accuracy, corporate audits, fee refunds, work schedules, forecasting, accuracy, and efficient operation.
• Complies with Bank security practices.
• Maintains customer confidentiality at all times.
Action Oriented – Is full of energy for the things he/she sees as interesting and challenging.
Building Effective Teams – Creates strong morale and spirit in his/her team.
Business Acumen - Understands how business works holistically.
Customer Focus - Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers.
Developing Direct Reports - Provides challenging and stretching tasks and assignments.
Directing Others - Is good at establishing clear direction.
Drive for Results - Can be counted on to successfully exceed goals.
Ethics and Values - Adheres to an appropriate and effective set of core values and beliefs during both favorable and challenging situations.
Integrity and Trust - Is seen as a direct and truthful individual.
Priority Setting - Spends his/her time and the time of others on the most critical needs of the business.
Job Requirements:
Basic Qualifications
• 3 years of Retail Banking sales experience with heavy emphasis on consumer and business development required
• Bachelor's degree in business-related major or equivalent of 2 years of successful sales management experience, preferably in financial services
• Must have excellent written and verbal (face-to-face and phone) communication skills including professional grammar and demeanor
• Intermediate PC proficiency
Other Traits, Characteristics and Experience
• Experience managing both a sales and operations team
• Demonstrated ability to coach and develop individuals and the team to high achievement in both sales and service
• Prefer proven success in meeting established sales and referral goals for banking products and services to include investment and insurance products
• Series 6 Securities license and Insurance License in good standing a plus
• Banking experience and community involvement in the local market helpful
• Strong organizational skills with attention to detail
• Ability to multi-task
Additional Details:
Grade 71
EOE/M/F/D/V
Huntington does not accept solicitation from Third Party Recruiters for any position.
